* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a high school graduate living in Linao East together with her parents. She was not able to enter college, therefore she involved herself in the retail business, selling grocery items to the people in her village. She is acquiring income to help support their daily needs. She has been in the busines for almost six years.

She would like to avail of a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, eggs and breads to sell. She aims to improve her sales and save funds for future expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs and breads to sell

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en:
Chanthorn is living in a rural area of the Battambang province in Moung Russey district. She is 46-year-old and married who has three children, one of whom is depending on her. Rice farming is the main source of her income. Sometime, she also works as a paid worker to support a family. And, she can save 26,000 KHR per day. She has been working with her business over ten years. 
This is the third cycle for her with VisionFund and the previous loans have improved her family living better. Now she and her member are applying for a loan of 2,000,000KHR and 1,000,000, respectively. As the leader, she will use the portion of her loan to buy fertilizers and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Irving

texts.en:
Irving is a 30 year old man, he is currently married to a loving wife, they have no kids yet, they are awaiting to manage a fair economic solvency before bringing children to this world. Irving provides for his house, nevertheless his wife contributes to the house income.
To address a living, Irving works as a supervisor on a machines factory, but he doesn't want to be an employer all his life, his biggest dream is to start a business of his own along with his wife. To achieve this massive goal, Irving is looking for a 15,000.00 MXN loan which will allow him to buy different thing to start his business.
Irving's wife happens to be a professional baker who is specialized on confectionery, therefore, the business they want to start is a bakery shop which will be managed by him and his wife. With the loan money they will buy ovens, raw material and refrigerators.
They are a young couple with huge dreams, therefore Kubo believes that it wont be long before the succeed.

loans.use: to start a bakery of his own

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs Mary O. is 40 years old. She lives in a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where she sells plastics and rubber to customers in her community. She is married with eight children. She is a dedicated client of LAPO. She says if she is loaned the sum of $300, her business will improve.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her business

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio has a farm where he cultivates rice. He has lived in Baba, Ecuador for his entire life working in agriculture. His education is very limited, but he has been able to raise two children through his rice cultivation. He has over 35 years of experience with this crop and he now has the help of his two sons who work with him. He is planning to use the loan to invest in pesticides and fertilizer for his land.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana-producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large multinational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soybeans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Baba

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain, there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soybeans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
My name is Norma P. and I produce and sell tortillas. I have had my business for 3 years. My clients are very good because tortillas are a staple food that people consume during lunch and dinner. My goal is to increment inventory in order to have larger sales and be able to provide sustenance for my family with the extra earnings I make.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Norma P. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que la tortilla es un alimento que mucha gente lo concume durante el almuerzo y la cena, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder sustentar mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase corn flour, cal, salt, firewood, matches

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman supports his wife and two year old daughter with his small market business selling house shoes and flip-flops. He started his business five years ago and has done well. His products are easy to market and are in demand year round. In Ukraine, it is customary to leave your outdoor shoes at the door when entering a home. Many people wear house shoes, or slippers, when they are indoors and often have extra pairs handy to offer guests.

Roman has requested a loan to make a major investment and improvement in his business by building a new vending kiosk. He’d like to be able to increase his retail space so that he can expand his inventory. Roman’s goal is to continue to develop his business and increase his income.

loans.use: Build new vending kiosk

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en: Lorenza, 48 years old, is living with her husband, a mechanic.  They don’t have any children.  Five years ago, Lorenza started a small home business.  She sells hair products like shampoo, rinse, olive oil, hair straightening products and some special soap.  Furthermore, she prepares some mixture for the hair.  This request for a loan is to buy a wider range of merchandise because for the last two weeks she has been in short supply.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of hair products as shampoo, rinse and special soap for hair.

loans.name: Hot

texts.en:
Mr. Y. Hot (aged 46) and his wife Mrs. Ly Mai Som (aged 40) got married in 1979. They have 6 children: 4 sons and 2 daughters. Hot and his family are in the fishing business, which he started in 1979. His wife helps him with selling fish in the village. The couple both did not finish primary school. Four of his children live with him and help him with his fishing. Two children were married and are also in fishing.

Mr Hot has borrowed money from MAXIMA thrice before. He is now requesting a $1,000 loan. He will use this money to purchase a fishing net and one new boat for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net and fisher-boat .

loans.name: Celmira

texts.es:
Celmira is 52 years old and lives in the district of Lamas in San Martin. She has a grown up son who no longer depends on her. She lives with her husband, and her mother, who is quite old now and depends on her daughter for financial support. Coming from a humble family without much money, Clemira attended school up until the 3rd grade of primary school only. Today she works selling fruits and vegetables, but before she became a part of the communal bank she did not have enough money to sufficiently stock her business. With the first loan she received she was able to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell. With her earnings and additional loans, she has built her business in the municipal market of Lamas and now offers more variety. With this loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a greater quantity of produce such as bananas, oranges, lemons, yuca, cilantro and onions in bulk, etc. Her dream is to be able to open a shop in her own home.

La señora Celmira tiene 52 años de edad, actualmente vive en el distrito de Lamas, provincia de Lamas, departamento de San Martín. Tiene un hijo mayor de edad que no depende de ella, vive con su esposo y su madre anciana la cual depende económicamente de ella. La señora Celmira estudió hasta el tercer grado de primaria, puesto que procede de una familia humilde. La señora Celmira se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, pero antes de pertenecer al banco comunal “ciudad de los 3 pisos” no contaba con el capital suficiente para surtir su negocio. Con el primer préstamo de S/: 300.00 que recibió de Manuela Ramos pudo comprar frutas y verduras, posteriormente con sus ganancias y con los otros préstamos que recibe en su Banco Comunal posee un negocio con variedad en el mercado municipal de Lamas. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras como plátanos en racimos, naranjas, limón, yuca en sacos, culantro en atados, cebollas en kilos, etc. Sueña con abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su propia casa.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE PRODUCE IN GREATER QUANTITIES TO STOCK HER BUSINESS, GROW HER PROFITS AND ONE DAY BE ABLE TO OPEN A SHOP IN HER OWN HOUSE.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es:
Sweets, sodas and frozen drinks are a few of the products that Apolonia works hard to sell outside the market at Leon station in San Juan park. From the time she was young, she has always been characterized as a hardworker. All her life she worked washing and ironing clothes for people in their homes, but she realized that this business was not viable. Five years ago she decided to start her own small business.

One of her problems at her advanced age, is the need to carry all of her products from her house to the the park in order to sell them. She works hard to take care of her two young grandchildren for whom she is responsible. She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel, who has helped her with 11 previous loans over the last few years. These loans allow her to maintain her business and take care of her grandchildren.

Dulces, gaseosas y agua helada son los productos que muy esforzadamente vende la señora Apolonia en las afueras del mercado la Estacion en Leon, exactamente en el parque San Juan. Desde muy niña, esta señora se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente trabajadora. Toda su vida la ha dedicado a lavar y planchar en los diferentes hogares pero al darse cuenta de que este negocio no es rentable, hace 5 años decidió comenzar un pequeño negocio de venta de dulces, gaseosas y agua helada.

Un problema que atraviesa es que a pesar de ser de edad muy avanzada, necesita trasladar sus productos desde su casa de habitación al parque donde vende siendo esto una faena diaria por subsistir y llevar el pan de cada día a sus dos pequeños nietos a su cargo. Para esto ha solicitado apoyo financiero en Ceprodel quien le ha apoyado con créditos para la compra de sus productos y de esta manera apoyarse ella y a sus dos nietos a su cargo que tanto necesitan de un apoyo por ser menores de edad. Su record crediticio es de 11 créditos desde hace dos años.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE PRODUCTS SUCH AS SWEETS, SODAS AND INGREDIENTS TO MAKE FROZEN DRINKS, WHICH SHE SELLS OUTSIDE THE MARKET.  THIS BUSINESS ALLOWS HER TO CARE FOR HER TWO YOUNG GRANDCHILDREN.

loans.name: Nhom Chi Xuyen - Vong Nguyet - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Xuyen, 57 years old, sells vegetables in the village central market. Besides, her family also works on rice field and breed pigs. Her two children are both going to work. Therefore, her family current income is pretty stable, approximately 6.25-7.5 USD/day. She wants to borrow money to buy more pig mash. Mrs. N. Thi Loan borrows money to buy pigs. Mrs. N. Thi Trang, Mrs. N. Thi Muon, Mrs. N. Thi Nga borrow money to buy pig mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Xuyên, 57 tuổi, buôn bán rau ở chợ trung tâm làng. N.ài ra, gia đình chị còn làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn. Chị có hai con đều đã đi làm, vì vậy thu nhập gia đình chị khá ổn định, khoảng 100000-120000đồng/ngày. Chị vay vốn để thêm vốn mua cám cho lợn ăn. Chị Ngô Thị Loan vay vốn mua lợn giống Chị Ngô Thị Trang, Chị Nguyễn Thị Muộn, Chị Ngô Thị Nga, đều vay vốn để mua cám cho lợn ăn, tăng gia sản xuất.

loans.use: buy pigs and pig mash

loans.name: Dau

texts.en:
Dau, 41 years old, sells groceries and brewed coffee in front of her home. She is able to earn between 5-10,000 VND (US$ 0.31-$ 0.62) per day. She wishes to increase her inventory so that she can sell more items. She received loan from Kiva on September 2007 that she paid back on time after four months.

Dau's husband Thanh, age 48, works at the train station. He fixes the railways when they are in bad condition, but he only gets paid 30,000 VND ($1.87) per day. With the money they earn, they are able to put food on the table, but they cannot afford to pay for their son's education, so he must stay home to help the family. Dau and Thanh have two children. D. Ngoc Son is 25 years old and D. T. Ha is 11 years old.

loans.use: To increase inventory in Dau's grocery store

loans.name: Thi Hoạch

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thị Hoạch is 55 years old (G. leader). She is requesting 2.006.000 VND to buy mash piglets to raise to increase her income. On top of raising pigs and working in her rice field, she also works as bricks transporter to increase her wage. She has 2 children, all grown up. Her husband is a retired cadre. He helps her out with her task. She likes SEDA because it allows her to make weekly payment, the paperwork is simple. Her family income is 120 USD a month, she will be able to pay back the loan.
Mrs N. Thị Kha is 42 years old. She requests a loan of 2.006.000 VND to raise poultry.
Mrs N. Thị Hường is 25 years old. She needs a loan of 354.000 VND to buy fertilizer for her rice field.
Mrs N. Thị Gái is 48 years old. She needs a loan of 354.000 VND to invest in her rice field.
Mrs N. Thị Ngợi is 55 years old. She needs a loan of 354.000 VND to invest in her rice field.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô N. Thị Hoạch (MS: 020024), năm nay 55 tuổi. Vay 2.006.000 VND vể để mua lợn chăn nuôi thêm. Bản thân cô làm ruộng và chăn nuôi, ngoài ra cô thường đi gánh gạch thuê để có thêm thu nhập. Cô có 2 con đã trưởng thành và đều đi làm. Chồng cô là một cán bộ về hưu, cũng giúp cô trong công việc chăn nuôi. Với cách thức vay trả tuần giúp cô tiết kiệm, còn có thủ tục nhanh thuận tiện nên cô rất thích vay ở chương trình, với mức thu nhập của gia đinh 120.000 VND/ tháng cô sẽ hoàn trả hết. Cô N. Thị kha (MS: 020025), năm nay 42 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi và phục vụ cho việc hút cát từ sông lên. Chị N. Thị Hường (MS: 020026, năm nay 25 tuổi, vay 354.000 VND để mua lân đạm bón lúa. Cô N. Thị Gái (MS: 020027), năm nay 48 tuổi, vay 354.000 VND để phục vụ cho việc làm nông nghiệp và đốt gạch ngói. Cô N. Thị Ngợi (MS: 020028), năm nay 55 tuổi, vay 354.000 VND phục vụ làm nông nghiệp.

loans.use: animal husbandry, agriculture

loans.name: Inna

texts.en:
Inna D. is married and has one daughter. Her family lives in Primorsk, Southern Ukraine. Irina sells trendy clothes for young people in the central city market. The location of her vending kiosk is very favorable as it’s in a busy place. Inna re-stocks her inventory regularly and tries to watch all new tendencies in fashion to make sure her assortment of merchandise pleases the different tastes of the young people who buy from her. Inna has been in this trade for 10 years. She has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. Presently, she has about $9000 in inventory. Her profit is about $2000 a month.

Inna is hoping to use this loan of 2500 Grivnas to increase the variety of inventory in her kiosk and keep her business running successfully this summer season. It’s always harder for entrepreneurs to keep their profits high in the summertime. However, Inna has her business in a resort city which hopefully will cause her profits go up this summer.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making pasties and candy

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
N. Shahlo is 26 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of two children. Shahlo has been in business since 2000. She embroiders national skull-caps for men and women. Shahlo produces national skull-caps of various types. As a result, she has many clients and usually there are many orders. Her mother-in-law helps her with the business. Shahlo sells the skull-caps in the local market. The business is stable and enables Shahlo to contribute significant income to the family budget.

Shahlo requests 800 USD for the term of 12 months. The loan is required to purchase fabric for embroidering the national skull-caps. Shahlo thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchase fabric for embroidering the national skull-caps.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar M. lives in the Djalollidini Rumi region of Tajikistan. She is 38 years old, married and has 4 children. Dilbar has been working in sales for the last six years. She manages a stand at the local market where she sells children's clothing. Due to recent slow down in sales Dilbar had spent some of the earning from the clothing stand on food for her family and now needs to take out a loan for 12 months to replenish her inventory for the upcoming school season.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Мирходжаева Дильбар проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Возраст 38 лет,замужем и имеет четверых детей. Шесть лет как занимаетс яторговлей . Имеет торговую точку на рынке района. Продает детскую одежду. Оборотная сумма немного уменьшилась по причине , что торговля ослабла и вся прибыль ушла на питание. Поэтому она решила получить кроедит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza M. sells groceries such as tinned tomatoes, milk, soft drinks and other products at Elmina. Adiza has received Junior High Education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a businessman.

Adiza has been selling groceries since 1998. She is responsible for paying for food for the family and the payment of their utility bills. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase her grocery inventory in her store. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in a building project she has started with her husband.

loans.use: to add to her  working capital

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teófilo tiene 33 años, es soltero, y por lo tanto independiente, vive solo en un cuarto que alquilo en el barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Juliaca.  Se dedica a trabajar en su motocarro, haciendo taxi, con el cual recorre la ciudad de Juliaca en busca de clientes a los cuales transportar, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, tiempo en el cual las calles le han enseñado este duro oficio.  Usualmente trabaja todo el día, pero las horas en las cuales tiene mayor clientela es por las mañanas, ya que la mayoría de las personas buscan llegar a sus centros de trabajo y estudio.  Le gusta trabajar con su moto, el cual considera su mayor herramienta y además su más fiel amigo, pero como todo trabajo, este también tiene su parte difícil y en el caso de Teófilo es el gran esfuerzo físico que tiene que realizar para transportar a las personas.   Teófilo se esfuerza día a día para mejorar su situación económica la cual en la actualidad no es muy buena el quiere progresar con el trabajo que realiza.  Con el dinero que gentilmente se le facilite a podrá comprar refacciones para su motocarro y así poder brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela. En el futuro Teófilo quiere poner un negocio paralelo al del transporte, para crecer económicamente  y personalmente.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 33 years old. He is single and independent and lives in a room he rents in the neighborhood of San Francisco in the city of Juliaca. He dedicates himself to working as a taxi driver. He goes around the city of Juliaca in search of clients. He has dedicated himself to this business for 10 years and during this time the streets have taught him this hard trade. He usually works all day but has the most clients in the mornings as most people are trying to get to work and school. He likes to work with his motorcycle which he considers his most important tool and most loyal friend. However, as with all work, there are some difficult parts of the job and in Teofilo's case it is the great physical effort that is required to transport people. Teofilo tries hard every day to improve his economic situation which currently is not too good. He wants to improve with his business. With the money he will receive from this loan he will be able to purchase parts for his motorcyle in order to provide a better service for his clients. In the future, Teofilo wants to open a transportation-related business in order to expand economically and personally.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of parts to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha T., 46, and her husband, Mr. Leang Mak, 61, live in a small village off of national road two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1984 and have three children; one son and two daughters. The first child is a factory worker, and other two children study in the local school.

Sokha has been selling fruit for one year. She buys fruit from the Dem Kor market and resells it in Toul Tumpong market. Her husband has been farming for seven years.

She is requesting a loan of to purchase fruit for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for reselling

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en: Bahodur is a 25-year-old young man who dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus.  He currently relies on two vehicles for his public transport business, one of which he drives personally. He rents the microbus.  He has a wife and two children.  Bahodur has about two years of experience in the public transportation field, and the competition is rather high in this business since there are so many people who need it.  His current loan request is so he can maintain his vehicle, since this is the tool of his trade.  So now Bahodur is counting on your help and requesting a loan of 1500 Somoni ($ 450 USD) for the term of 5 months.  With the loan he’ll purchase the spare parts for his microbus.  With your support, Bahodur will continue to progress.

loans.use: To purchase the spare parts to repair his microbus.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур парень в возрасте 26 лет имеет 4 детей,работает электриком на фабрике по производству соков и томатов г.Костакоз.Каждый воскресный день Баходур выходит на рынок и перепродает скот.Он уже 6 лет как занимается этим бизнесом.С ним многие советуются по выбору купли скота.Баходур хорошо понимает в породах скота.Поэтому для закупа дешёвого мелкарогатого скота он хочет взять кредит.
texts.en:
Bahodur is a 26-year-old who has four children. He works as an electrician in a factory in Kostakoz where juice and tomatoes are processed. Every Sunday Bahodur goes to the market and sells cattle. He has been in this business for six years. Many look to him for advice on how to choose cattle for purchase. Bahodur knows breeds of cattle very well, and therefore he would like to take out a loan for the purchase of inexpensive small-horned cattle.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Unisi Nalumansi  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Unisi is the leader of a five member group. She is 32 years old and married with three children who are between the ages of 11 and 15. All her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in a rented two-roomed house in which five people stay. They have electricity and piped water at home and the family gets three meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Unisi deals in second-hand shoes in Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She works seven days a week. She also buys these shoes from Owino market. Unisi uses public transport to and from work. She rents her business premises for 60,000 per month and sells on retail. She sells to an average of ten customers a day and to all categories of people. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She has been in MCDT for five years and is servicing her tenth loan, working all along with the same groupmates. Unisi wants this loan to buy more shoes for resale. She also aspires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Thorn P. is 25 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a true entrepreneur who has a business selling clothes at the market. On average, she makes $15 in revenue every day. Her husband is a policeman and earns $4 a day. She and her husband have one little child. She would like to request a loan to add more clothes to her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Maria Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba inició el negocio para tenar un ingreso extra para poder solventar gastos familiares y al mismo tiempo estar al pendiente de su hija, por lo que empezó a vender ropa de segunda mano en su casa, poco a poco fue haciendo clientes y ha logrado incrementar sus ventas.

Ahora ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $3000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para comprar mercancía y poder continuar con su negocio, con tu apoyo esto será posible.
texts.en:
Rosalba started her business as a way to earn extra income to cover household expenses and take care of her daughter. She started selling second-hand clothing out of her house, getting new customers little by little, and has managed to increase her sales. Now she needs a loan of MXN $3000, which she will pay off in 8 bi-weekly payments, to purchase more merchandise and continue with her business. With your support, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old-man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife. Ali owns a coffee shop. He sells all kinds of hot drinks, cold beverages and "nargileh." The nargileh (also known as “shisha” in Egypt) is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Nargileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East, and is beginning to gain popularity in the U.S., Europe and other countries. Ali requested a loan of $2,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his coffee shop. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. 

Ali is special in his work because his coffee shop is a nice and cozy place. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. Ali decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his coffee shop

loans.name: Vilma Frecia

texts.es:
La señora Vilma Frecia Y. E. tiene 59 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Auxiliar de Enfermería, carrera que ejerció durante 5 años y que abandono para dedicarse al cuidado de su hogar. Tiene 04 hijos y ninguno depende de ella económicamente.
Vilma tiene una bodega, inicio su negocio vendiendo algunos abarrotes en casa de su madre el mismo que abandono cuando viajo a argentina y que al regresar puso nuevamente en su domicilio, amplio su negocio con la venta de gaseosas y otros productos que le dejan ganancias. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Jerid Camino al Éxito II”, lo invirtió en la compra de arroz y gaseosas.  
Con el crédito de 1200 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos y gaseosas para ampliar el capital de trabajo.
Vilma sueña con terminar de construir su casa y le gustaría viajar a Argentina.
texts.en:
Señora Vilma Frecia Y. E. is 59 years old and lives in the Salaverry district of the province of Trujillo, in the region of La Libertad, Peru. She went to school to be a medical assistant and worked in this field for 5 years until she left it so that she could dedicate herself to being a homemaker. She has 4 children, but they are all independent now. Vilma owns a shop. She first dabbled in the business when she started selling groceries out of her mother's house, but left this behind when she traveled to Argentina. Upon her return however, she set up a small store in her own house, and expanded into the sale of meals, soft drinks and a variety of other products that sell well. Her business continues to develop in her own home. The first loan she received from the Jerid Camino al Éxito II Communal Bank was of 300 soles, which she used to buy rice and soft drinks. This loan of 1,200 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, will be used to buy soft drinks and the ingredients for her meals in order to increase her working capital. Vilma dreams of finishing construction on her house and would one day like to visit Argentina again.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and various ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Sangin

texts.ru:
Сангин Розиков мужчина 59 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. Проживает в Ганчинском районе. Животноводство для Сангина основной источник доходов в его семье. Он имеет большой стаж в этой сфере и опыт, так как занимается откормом скота и его  продажей около 19 лет. Дома у Сангина 7 голов крупнорогатого скота, он хочет получить займ, в размере 300 сомони, сроком на 6 месяцев, для закупа корма для домашнего скота.
 Кроме животноводства Сангин работает в сфере сельского хозяйства.Он дехканин.
texts.en:
Sangin R. is a 59-year-old man, who is married and has four children. He lives in the Ganchin district, where raising livestock is his main source of family income. Sangin has been in this line of work for many years and has a great deal of experience, since he has raised and sold cattle for nearly 19 years. Sangin has seven head of large-horned cattle at home, and he wants a six-month loan in the amount of 300 somoni to purchase cattle feed. In addition to raising livestock, Sangin works in agriculture. He is a farmer.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Boboto Plus Group

texts.fr: Muteba N. est accoucheuse de formation, elle a une pharmacie qu’elle gère avec son mari dans la partie montagneuse de l’ouest de Kinshasa. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2007 avec un capital de $150. Avec un dur travail et une bonne gestion, Muteba est parvenue à atteindre en 2009 un capital de $300. Elle est cliente fidèle de Hope qui a reçu sept fois les crédits et les a remboursés totalement et à temps. Muteba compte avec le crédit reçu au mois de mai courant, acheter les médicaments à revendre et diversifier son activité en ouvrant une cabine téléphonique. Son affaire génère un bénéfice de $120 par mois. Muteba a l’ambition d’ouvrir un dépôt pharmaceutique. Elle est agée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de dix enfants dont leurs âges varient de 13 à 36 ans. Quatre d’entre eux sont indépendants et les autres sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Muteba N. is an obstetrician by training. She has a pharmacy she manages with her husband in the mountainous part of western Kinshasa. She started this business in 2007 with $150 in capital. Through hard work and good managing, Muteba managed to reach $300 in capital in 2009. She is a loyal client of Hope, and she has received seven loans and repaid them totally and on time. With the loan received this May, she intends to buy medicines to resell and to diversify her business by opening a phone booth. Her business generates $120 of profit each month. Muteba's ambition is to open a pharmaceutical outlet. She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of ten children, ranging in age from 13 to 36. Four of them are on their own, and the others are in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines to resell and to open a telephone booth

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch K., 50, is a village woman living in Kompong Cham Province. Since the beginning of 2005, Ouch K. owned an old bicycle and used it to pick up a few products to sell door-to-door around her village. She sells items like pork, fish, and vegetables, and typically makes $3 profit a day to meet her family’s daily expenses. Her husband, Om Pho, 55, is a local farmer. This couple has four children who are married. With this loan, Ouch K. will purchase a plot of plantation from a villager in order to greatly grow various kinds of crops. This will enable the family to accrue an extra profit to meet their daily expenses. Ouch K. was not available for the photograph, so her husband is in the photo instead at their house.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of plantation

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Дилором женщина 29-лет.Замужем имеет одного ребёнка.Она занимается продажей продуктов и питание.Она торгует в магазине где находиться в центре города Табошар.Она закупает товар из рынка "Панчшанбе" городе Худжанда.Её муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию, чтобы там зарабатывать деньги, как и многие рабочие мигранты. Дилором старается расширить свой бизнес и закупать макароны, сахар и другие, для расширения своего ассортимента. Этим она хочет увеличить свой семейный доход.
texts.en:
Dilorom is 29 years old, married, and has one child. She sells food in a shop at the center of Taboshar city. She buys her goods from the the Panshabe market in Khudjand city. Her husband is in Russia earning money to send remittances back home, like many migrant workers. Dilorom is trying to expand her business to purchase pasta, sugar, and other things to expand her product range. This is how she seeks to increase her family income.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of food products

loans.name: Rubina Muhammad Zahid Mahmood Group

texts.en:
Rubina baji has lived in Lahore, Pakistan, since past 15 years. The city of Lahore is famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods. Rubina baji is uneducated because her parents had little financial resources and couldn’t send her to school. She is married to M. Z. M., who has a soft toys selling business. He has a strong client base as he offers a variety in toys. Rubina baji is a hardworking lady. She prepares embroidered clothes at home by taking orders from neighbors and relatives. She saves income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount. She is applying for a loan to buy soft toys to expand her husband’s business. 

There are four additional borrowers for this loan:

Naseem baji wants a loan to buy food ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food-selling business.
Abida baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.
Shumaila baji wants a loan to buy embroidered materials (beads, colored thread and patterns) for preparing embroidered dresses.
Khalida baji wants a loan to buy colored thread and tools for her carpet-weaving business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy soft toys to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa sells charcoal and chocoties (a mixture of beans and maize) every day in the Manyatta neighborhood of Kisumu. She used to sell in the Oile Market closer to town, but the post-election violence at the end of 2007 forced her to move her business. She wants to grow her business and provide a good education for her five children. She says that she wants to give her children something that she never had—the chance to learn in school.

For Teresa, life is still very challenging. Her husband is a boda boda driver (bicycle taxi) and makes very little money. She says that after household expenses, there is very little left to put back into the business. She would like to take her loan and buy more charcoal, maize, and beans. With a little boost, her business can help provide the income her family needs.

loans.use: More charcoal, maize, and beans to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena B. is from the village of Lao Sta Cruz. She is 56 years old. Elena is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Elena is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Elena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Thank God #1 Group

texts.en:
Kpana, a 35-year-old woman, is married with five children between the ages of 5 and 18. She also cares for one child orphaned in the war. Kpana’s business is making clothes for the farming community. She sells in a temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors of various trades.  She has been running her business for three years. She is illiterate because, although she wanted to attend school, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide. Kpana lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa county – the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Kpana's dream is to grow her business until she can build a permanent tailor's shop. She is taking out this loan to buy sewing materials, thread and cloth. With the profits from her business, Kpana dreams of building a permanent house and sending her children to school (which she was denied).

"Thank God #1" is a group of five borrowers, led by Kpana J., living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

loans.use: To purchase sewing material, thread and cloth

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina is a member of the Idope borrower group in Kinayanambo, Iringa. She  is married and a mother of 4 children. He children are 23, 21, 18, 15 years old.

Josephina has owned a business for 5 years, she works 8 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Josephina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for making local beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Josephina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for local beer

loans.name: Chuluundorj

texts.en:
Chuluundorj B. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Harhorin, the capital city of the ancient Mongolian empire. Both of his children, a son and daughter, attend a local secondary school. His wife works as a janitor at her children's school.

Chuluundorj manages a business in his town making wooden products. He is a very busy man, as he operates his wood business during the day and supplements his income by driving a taxi at night. B. started his wood-products business in 2000 and has since found much success in his trade. With his savings, he was able to purchase his car and start the taxi service in 2005.

B. has worked very hard at growing his business, but was forced to halt operations for three years to take care of his ailing father. However, today, he is working again and says, "My only wish now is to finish building my house, which will greatly improve my family's quality of life." He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase more wood for his wood-products business.

loans.use: To buy more wood for his business

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona D. is from the village of Balintawak St., Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Chona is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Chona owns & operates a business in the food sector making & selling food. Her main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Chona has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Chona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Chona is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Chona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional food products to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta H. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis, Oriental. She is 32 years old. Julieta is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Julieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: B. Véronique est née le 05 Juillet 1971 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé, au Bénin. Véronique est mariée à FONTECLOUNON Cyril, un carroleur. Le couple a deux enfants. Mais en plus de ces enfants, un autre enfant est à leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. C'est depuis 13 ans que la famille vit à PK10 Bahocon, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Véronique a très peu fréquenté l'école. Il y a 10 ans de cela que Véronique vend des liqueurs de tous genres, des divers (fournitures scolaires, papiers mouchoirs, lait, poudre, défrisants, coton, etc.) et de l'huile végétale dans sa boutique sise au bord de la von Bahocon dans son quartier. Véronique s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la première fois que Véronique sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d'augmenter son capital et de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
B. Véronique was born on the 5th of July, 1971, in Adjohoun, in the county of Ouémé, in Bénin. Véronique is married to Fonteclounon Cyril, a mason. The couple has 2 children. In addition to their 2 children, they also care for one other child. Some of the children are attending school. For the past 13 years, the family has lived in PK10 Bahocon, in the county of Sèmè-Podji, in Benin. Together, the couple takes care of their family's expenses. Véronique attended very little school. For the past 10 years, Véronique has been selling a variety of liquors, various items (school supplies, paper handkerchiefs, milk, powder, straightening balm, cotton etc.) and vegetable oil, in her store located on the border of Bahocon, in her neighborhood. Véronique supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. This is the first time that Véronique has requested a loan from ALIDé; she is requesting the loan in order to grow her capital and strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase liquor, straightening balm, vegetable oil, paper napkins, milk

loans.name: Crystal Business Group

texts.en:
Aletha N. S. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Crystal Business. She is 35 years old, married with 7 children aged 2-14 years old. Their educational levels are from 1st to8th grade. She also cares for 3 siblings.

Aletha is a 10th grade drop-out due to lack of financial support.She and her family live and work in the Civil compound community in Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county,Liberia.
Her business is the sales of general goods.She buys general goods wholesale and sells retail to residents of her community in Gbarnga the capital of Bong County, Liberia.  Aletha has been running this business for 2 years, and is hoping to improve her business. The high price of goods and cost of transportation from wholesalers is really a difficulty for Aletha’s business. She requests this loan to purchase more supplies of goods to improve business. 

Aletha dreams of empowering her children for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies of goods to improve business.

loans.name: Agbalevi

texts.en: Mrs. K. runs a restaurant called Chez Mami in the Bé quarter of Lomé. She is married to a photographer and they have two children. This will be her first loan with WAGES, which she will use to buy ten pigs for her business. Because she is able to buy animals at a lower cost in Burkina Faso, she will travel north to make the purchase there. This loan will help sustain her business throughout the holiday season.

loans.use: To buy pigs to use in a restaurant

loans.name: Clara Quispe

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Clara pertenece al Banco Comunal “COMUZONE” D. la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene seis hijos.
 
Clara es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para sus hijos y después D. hacer sus actividades del hogar atienD. su tienda D. venta D. comestibles. Ya son 8 meses que se dedica al negocio D. venta D. comestibles y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leches, gaseosas y cervezas.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Clara belongs to the Comuzone Communal Bank with the Arariwa Association. She is 49, married, and has six children. Clara is a hard-working and entrepreneurial mother who gets her family ahead. She gets up very early to do her household chores. For example, she makes breakfast for her children. After her household chores, she tends her grocery store. She has been in the business of selling food for eight months. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs the loan to buy food like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, soft drinks, and beer. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk, soft drinks, and beer

loans.name: Kocha 33 Group

texts.en:
Mahboba is the group leader of Kocha 33 group.She lives in Kabul Afghanistan. She is married with two childern one son and on daughter they are 10 and 15.She is a quilt sewer. She can see different kinds of quilts with great designs and most of her neighbors like her way of work. Most of the time they tell her to sew quilts which are used for brides here as a custom. She wants to take a loan to purchase cloth and the other essential materials for her business.
She hopes to expand her business and to hire an employee to support her in her buisness.

loans.use: purchasing cloth and materials

loans.name: Funes Mendoza Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario F. M. está conformado por 2 personas muy trabajadoras. Alejandrina tiene 66 años y su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 21 años que se ha dedicado a dedicado a mejorar sus ingresos por medio este logro proporcionarle a sus 4 hijos los estudios necesarios y que fueran personas de bien, actualmente trabajan de manera independiente. Su amiga Ángela Martina se dedica  a una pulpería, ella inicio porque su amiga Alejandrina  le proporciono el apoyo para que estableciera su propio negocio en su vivienda. Ellas solicitan este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para materia prima. Sus deseos es seguir con vida y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
The F. M. Solidarity Group consists of two hardworking individuals. Alejandrina is 66 years old and manages a grocery store. For more than 21 years, she has focused on improving her income through this business so that she could provide for her four children and supply them with an education. As a result, they developed to become good people. She currently works independently.

Her friend Ángela Martina also runs a grocery store. Ángela started her business because her friend Alejandrina helped her to establish it from home. They are requesting a loan to use as operating capital to acquire raw materials. Their hopes are to carry on with their lives and continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is married to Tata Frankline. She is the mother of five children. She is currently requesting her third loan from GHAPE. She has been with GHAPE since 2007 and has demonstrated a credit-worthy character exemplified by her repayments, consistent attendance of meetings and support of her borrowing group. 

Vivian raises chickens and transports passengers on her motorcycle. With this latest loan, Vivian is hoping to continue the business supported by her prior loans. The fowl eventually will be sold on Foncha street and the motorbike will be roaming the Bamenda town carrying passengers. She is confident that her business will succeed because it is located in a strategic position within the market. She also feels that her friendly approach towards her customers also makes a big difference. 

Vivian hopes to use the profits from her business to provide for the various needs of her family. She hopes to increase her profits so she has enough to pay for her children’s school fees, open an account, and provide for her family’s nourishment. 

About GHAPE:

Her loan will be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle, chickens, and chicken feed

loans.name: Aldiojojan

texts.en:
Aldiojojan B. is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. He is 40 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Aldiojojan owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as candies, sugar, noodles, shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc. in the local community. Aldiojojan has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Aldiojojan joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Aldiojojan is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his fifth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Melonne

texts.fr: A. Melonne est née le 19 juin 1968 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Cela fait bientôt cinq ans que Melonne vit à Abomey Calavi, au Bénin. Mariée à TOHON Sosthène, un chaffeur, Melonne est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Melonne a encore trois autres enfants à sa charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants. Melonne et son mari supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour contribuer aux dépenses, Melonne gère un salon de coiffure à son domicile et par la même occasion y vend des mèches. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Melonne se procure les produits dont elle a besoin pour le bon fonctionnement de son salon.  Melonne exerce cette activité depuis huit ans environs et a obtenu une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Melonne désire agrandir davantage son salon de coiffure et renforcer ses outils de travail, afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Adoukounou Melonne was born June 19, 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. It is almost 5 years since Melonne has been living in Abomey Calavi, in Benin. Married to Tohon Sosthene, a driver, Melonne is the mother of two children all in school. Melonne has 3 more other children at her care. The couple live together with the children. Together, Melonne and her husband bear the expenses of the family. To contribute to the family expenses, Melonne runs a hairdressing salon at home and sells hair extensions in the salon through the same opportunity. It is in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin that Melonne gets the products that she needs for the smooth running of her salon. Melonne has been doing this business for about eight years and has already got a loan from ALIDe that she repaid. Melonne wants to extend more her hairdressing salon and to beef up her working tools in order to meet the demands of her customers. This makes her to request a second loan.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of  beauty products and hair extensions

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty N. est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU depuis 7 ans et demi d'où elle a bénéficié de 15 crédits qui lui permettent jusqu'à aujourd'hui de développer son activité d'embouche bovine. Elle va acheter du foin et une paire de bœufs les engraisser puis les vendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Maty N. is 43 years old, married and mother to eight children, who are all in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in KEUR NGALGOU for seven and a half years and has had 15 loans, which have allowed her to develop her sheep fattening business up until the present time. She is going to buy hay and a pair of oxen which she will fatten up and sell after four to five months. Her objective is to help out her husband with the family responsibilities.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a pair of oxen to fatten up

loans.name: Ram Payari

texts.en:
Mrs. Ram Payari N., 47 years old, lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family household with her husband and three sons.

Her husband, Mr. Badri Man N., and her three sons make traditional idols. In Nepal, idol-making work is very famous, and the demand for idols is also increasing. They now need money to buy raw materials to make more traditional idols to meet the demand.

She seeks NPR 30000.00 loan to buy raw materials for making traditional idols.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making idols

loans.name: Abla Ama

texts.fr:
Cette femme est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle s’est spécialisée dans le commerce des vêtements pour enfants.
Elle exerce cette activité depuis 6 ans. Les marchandises proviennent de la Chine et elle les acquiert auprès des grossistes sur place. Elle les revend ensuite dans sa boutique au grand marché de Lomé.
L’objet de ce crédit est l’achat de nouveaux stocks de vêtements pour enfants pour réapprovisionner sa boutique.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of three children. She specializes in selling children’ clothing. She has been doing it for six years. The merchandise arrives from China, and she purchases it from local wholesalers. She then resells it at her store at the big market of Lomé. The purpose of this credit is to purchase a new supply of children’s clothing in order to restock her store.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing clothes and scarves [for resale]

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba M. bakes meat pies, cakes and other pastries at Abura.  Araba is divorced and is taking care of six dependants. Araba has been selling pastries for some time now. She spends her income on the welfare of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to bake for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to bake

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Tum N., 49, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. N. and her husband sell firewood for an income of US $5 per day. N. is requesting a loan of US $750 to purchase a plot of farmland to grow rice. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to grow rice

loans.name: Jones

texts.en:
Jones is truly a hard worker. He is a 36-year-old carpenter with special skills in manufacturing loud speakers.  He skillfully cuts pieces of plywood to make loud speakers by custom order according to the designs and preferences of his customers. He has been operating his trade for eighteen years and is eager to be taking out this loan. He plans to use this loan to purchase plywood in bulk to support his business.

Jones is married to a woman who works in a printing press. They have three children aged 7–11. He says that he dreams of being able to generate enough profits to be able to educate his children to the tertiary school level.

loans.use: To purchase plywood in bulk

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio M. Z. quiere poner lo cimientos para iniciar a construir un cuarto en su vivienda para ofrecer a su familia un mayor espacio y confort. Su casa el la construyo con ahorros propios que ya se termino en lo cual el requiere del apoyo de capital para poder terminar su proyecto. Sergio y su esposa son personas trabajadoras y responsables.
texts.en:
Sergio M. Z. wants to lay the cement to start construction of a room on his house so that his family will have more space and comfort. He built his house with his own savings but they are now gone, and now he needs help with some capital so that he can finish the project. Sergio and his wife are hard-working and responsible people.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cement for a room

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena R. is from the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Efrena has a retail store selling street food such as banana cue, camote cue, and chicharon. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Efrena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Efrena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding the business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa D. S., 37, who wants to achieve more in life not just for herself but for her family as well. Marissa lives in GMA, Cavite with her husband, Hermogenes, who is a jeepney driver. They have three children, one of whom is in elementary graD., and the other two are already married.

Marissa is in the business of direct selling brand apparel, cosmetics, footwear, and accessories, which cater mainly to people near their residence in GMA. Direct selling of beauty products and other items depends largely on Marissa'a perseverance and social connections. Marissa and Hermogenes gather a net income of Php10,000 monthly, which they use to meet the needs of the entire family.

Marissa admits that she needs a Php13,000 loan to enhance her business and increase her profits. She applied to CCT* for this loan, which she plans to use to further her direct selling business, which includes brands such as Avon, Natasha and MSE. Basically, the loan will serve as additional capital that will enable Marissa to make her business more profitable and lead to more savings.

At present, Marissa sees that her business is not that profitable. She also experiences problems in collection and dealing with customers, and even balancing the time for family and business. Still, Marissa is determined not to be swayed by these struggles and aims to make her business grow. She prays that she will find a commercial area where her business can thrive and flourish. More importantly, she dreams of seeing her children finish their studies and be used as one family for the glory of the Lord whom they serve.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase orders in advance for her customers.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 36 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 5 hijos. Desde que era niña se ha dedicado a la agricultura y ganadería, actualmente lo sigue realizando en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos que ya son mayores, es así que cultivan papa así como algunos cereales y verduras ya que reciben buenas ganancias, lo necesario para el sostén de su familia. Por otro lado, se dedica a la crianza de vacas y ovejas, que son albergadas en su establo, por el cual los saca a pastar al campo. Estas dos actividades involucran a la familia, por ser trabajos que requieren de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y por tal no descansan hasta lograr que su producción aumente y que sus animales se vean bien gordos y saludables. Teodora afirma que le gusta trabajar en el campo porque le agrada disfrutar el paisaje del campo, además esta habituada al ritmo de trabajo que tiene, y por ello desea seguir creciendo en la siembra y en la cantidad de animales que tiene. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de animales y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Teodora is 36 years old and she lives in her own home together with her husband and their 5 children. Since she was a little girl she has worked as an agriculturist and as a farmer. She works together in the business with her husband and two of their grown children. They cultivate cereals and vegetables, these being the most profitable harvests. This business is the source of support for the family. She also raises cows and sheep. She keeps them in a stable but she takes them out to the fields. These two businesses involve the entire family. They require a lot of work and dedication and need constant attention to keep up production and that their livestock be in large and in good health. Teodora loves to work in the fields and she enjoys the landscapes. She is used to the work schedule and she wishes to keep cultivating her fields and keep the same number of livestock in her herds. This is her seventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is very happy to have the financial support. She has always been very responsible with her payments. She also enjoys being a member of her community bank because all of the members are very responsible and they are all team players. She is grateful to everyone that will contribute tot he loan. The loan will be very useful in the progress of her business. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of more livestock and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and livestock.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima is 37 years old.  She is a widow and has five children between the ages of 15 and 19.  All of her children are enrolled in school.  With the proceeds from this loan, Salima will purchase clothes to sell.  She plans to save any profits that she makes on the business.  Currently Salima does not have a business location.  Instead she delivers the clothes that she sells to her clients.  In the future she would like to have a shop.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ulices

texts.es: Ulises, de 40 años, es un hombre honesto y sensible, vive con su esposa de 36 años, ellos tienen 4 hijos, todos menores, a los cuales cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Desde los 23 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, ahí comenzó a sembrar papa y arveja, los que ahora vende en el mercado central de su ciudad, como también visita otras zonas aledañas, como Matahuasi. Disfruta mucho sembrar arvejas porqué sabe que tendrá mayores ganancias en corto tiempo y sobre todo invirtiendo menos. Pero en realidad lo que más le gusta a Ulises es poder arar la tierra, es así que desde muy temprano se dirige a otros terrenos de cultivo para brindarle sus servicios; por ello cuenta con dos toros que posee, ya que le ayuda a voltear la tierra, de esta manera se genera otros ingresos. En adelante esta planeando abrir un negocio de compra y venta de arvejas; donde podrá vender al por mayor. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP y como secretario de su banco comunal se siente muy contento de poder planificar y apoyar a su grupo. Con el crédito que obtendrá podrá comprar abono y guano (producto natural que fortifica a los cultivos), para la papa que está sembrando.
texts.en:
Ulises, forty, is an honest and sensitive man.  He lives with his wife, thirty-six, with whom he has four young children that he cares for and educates in his own house in Chiras.  He has earned his living in agriculture since he was twenty-three. He started out planting potatoes and peas, which he now sells at the central market in his city and areas nearby, like Matahuasi.

He really enjoys growing peas, because he knows he can make a big profit in short time with little investment.  However, what he really likes best is being able to till the land, which he does on other people's lands from early in the morning.  For that, Ulises says, he has two oxen to help him turn the soil, which helps him generate more income.  In the future he plans to open a business buying and selling peas wholesale.

This will be Ulises' seventh loan with MFP and as secretary of his village bank he feels very happy to be able to support and draw up plans for his group.  He plans to use his loan to buy fertilizer and guano (a natural product for fortifying crops), for the potatoes he's planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to fortify his potato crop.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 45 years old. Delia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Delia is hoping to have a stable income to sustain her family's needs.

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Delia is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty H. is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Betty is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has 5 children and 2 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif A. is a 49 year old livestock breeder who raises cattle for meat purposes. He is married and has 6 children.  Arif has four years of experience in this field and now has four head of cattle. He lives and works in the small village of Imishli. Once every three months he takes his cattle to sell at the livestock bazaar. Arif has applied for 1000 AZN loan to purchase three baby calves.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Isaac Karanja

texts.en:
Isaac has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He is 37 years old, married to Mary Nyawira Karaya, and they have four children.
