He got to know about KADET through various marketing activities carried out by KADET staff in Ndunyu Njeru town. He repaid his first loan well and in good time. He plans to use the current loan amount to purchase a cow.

In the future, Isaac hopes to increase farm production by practicing large-scale farming, hence improving his living standards.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Hernan

texts.en:
Hernan is fifty four years old. He lives in the district of Tambogrande in northern Peru. Tambogrande is a semi-tropical zone, just a few hours away from the coastal desert in the province of Piura. It is primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers. Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise animals. Hernan owns his home. He shares it with is wife and one of their children, who still lives at home.

Hernan owns a hectare of land in the region, on which he has lime trees. He harvests approximately four baskets of limes weekly from his farm, which he sells in local markets, to wholesalers or to local factories. He can regularly be found trimming his trees, to improve their productivity, or harvesting limes.  

In addition to the lime orchard, Hernan and his wife raise sheep in corrals behind their home. They raise the animals for their meat and sell them (once they reach the appropriate size) at local markets. The animal meat serves an important role in the nutrition of the local population and in the cultural traditions of Peru.

This loan will be used to hire a number of field laborers who will complete a general cleaning and overhaul of the lime orchard fields and ditches. Hernan expects the investment will improve production and reduce the risk of diseases and pests.

loans.use: To hire a number of field laborers to complete a general cleaning and overhaul of the lime orchard fields and ditches.

loans.name: Margaritas De Tlatelulco Group

texts.es: El  grupo se llama MARGARITAS DE TLATELULCO se encuentra ubicado en Toluca, Estado de México. Está conformado por 11 integrantes, entre ellas está la Sra María de Jesus quien tiene 28 años de edad y 3 hijos: 2 mujeres y 1 hombre, todos estudiando. Ella se dedica a vender pan desde hace 8 años, comenta que decidió iniciar su negocio porque los ingresos de su esposo muchas veces no le alcanzaban para cubrir sus necesidades y las de sus hijos.  Su deseo de ella es algún dia poner un local para vender su pan, tener por lo menos 2 empleadas de su misma comunidad y darles estudios a sus hijos, ya que ella no pudo terminar ni la primaria.
texts.en: This group is called MARGARITAS DE TLATELULCO. It is located in Toluca, in the State of México. It is made up of 11 members. Among them is María de Jesus, who is 28 years old and has 3 children, 2 girls and one boy, all of whom are in school. She has worked selling bread for the past 8 years. She comments that she decided to start her business because her husband's income was often not enough to cover their needs and those of their children. Her desire is to open a shop one day where she can sell her bread, to have at least 2 employees from the community where she lives, and be able to pay for her children's studies, since she herself was not even able to finish primary school.

loans.use: Buying supplies for her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph M. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog, Bukidnon. He is 39 years old. Joseph is married and has a child. To make a living, Joseph runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste. He is also raising and selling pigs. Joseph has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Joseph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joseph has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Joseph is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods, and as working capital. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Joseph from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods and as working capital

loans.name: Duo Esfuerzo Del Mañana Group

texts.es: Duo Esfuerzo del Mañana: Este grupo esta foramdo por doña Emilia P. de 43 años, casada Con dos Hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por mas de 15 años, Solicita este credito para la compra de ropa por mayor, tambien esta doña Cristina C. ella es la lider de este grupo ella tiene su tienda de productos comestibles, ella nos cuenta que le a hido muy bien en su negocio, gracias al apoyo de fape ella a hido superandose, ademas esta solicitando un nuevo credito para surtir su tienda con utiles escolares, y asi seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Tomorrow’s Effort Duo:  This group is made up of Mrs. Emilia P., 43.  She’s married and has two children.  She’s been selling clothes for over 15 years.  She is asking for this loan to buy clothes at wholesale.

Also in it is Mrs. Cristina C..  She is the group leader and has a grocery store.  She tells us that she’s done very well in the business. Thanks to support from FAPE she’s been improving.  She’s asking for anew loan to stock her store with school supplies thus continuing with her business.

loans.use: To buy school supplies at wholesale and to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida lives in Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She lives there in the area of Daata town with her family in a 2 room brick house. She moved here 25 years ago. 
Her husband’s name is M. S., and he is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to his clients. She is the mother of 2 daughters and a son. Her son works in a private organization and her daughters are studying in a local school. 
Zahida operates a clothes business to financially support her family. She buys clothes from AnarkA., which is a famous clothes market of Lahore, and  sell to her customers and generates good income. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the betterment of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material, such as beads and colored thread, and clothes in bulk, which will allow her to fulfill the orders on time and make extra profits. 
She has been operating this business for the past 20 years and hopes that it will grow further after making an investment in it. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady who is showing her embroidered dress is Zahida”.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business

loans.name: Patriciah

texts.en: Patriciah is a 37-year-old widowed lady with four children. To make a living and provide for her children, she runs a taxi business and also operates a retail shop to earn extra income. She was previously a farmer. Being the breadwinner in her family, she works hard to meet her children's basic needs, including education. Patriciah has been running her business for 11 years and it has grown since she joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. Her living standards have improved as a result. Patriciah dreams of owning more taxi cars in the future. She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy a gearbox.

loans.use: To buy a gearbox

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Kuña Guapa se conformó en el año 2007, y han crecido mucho como comité por las situaciones vividas. Todas las integrantes son muy trabajadoras y responsables con sus cuotas.
Las señoras son de la ciudad de Encarnacion, distante a 15 km. de la oficina de la fundación. Ellas destinan su dinero para diversas actividades en la zona en donde viven.
Actualmente, 7 señoras son las más antiguas del grupo, y otras integrantes han ido rotando por diferentes razones, pero siempre encontraron mujeres responsables para reemplazar a las salientes.
Las mujeres están contentas porque siempre avanzan de nivel y monto económico al cual acceden pues así pueden aumentar sus mercaderías y tener más ingresos.
Solicitan por décima primera vez el crédito, pasando al siguiente ciclo por el excelente pago en sus cuotas.
La sra. Zulma S. posee una despensa en su domicilio, desde donde provee de todos los productos de primera necesidad a sus vecinos, ella desea poder aumentar sus ingresos económicos pero la única manera de realizar esa meta es aumentando la cantidad de productos ofrecidos, y también aumentar la calidad de estos, por ello solicita el crédito, para poder comprar artículos de limpieza, aseo personal, de librería, entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee “Kuña Guapa” was established in 2007. The members have grown tremendously as a committee through the situations they have experienced. All of the members are hardworking and responsible with their payments. These women are from the city of Encarnación, which is 15km from the office of Fundación Paraguaya. They will use this money for their various business activities that are conducted in the area where they live.

There are currently seven women who are long-time members of the group. Other members have rotated in and out for different reasons, but responsible women are always found to replace the ones who have left. The members are pleased because they have always been able to raise their financial standard of living, increase their inventories, and generate more income. They are requesting their eleventh loan and entering this next loan cycle with an excellent payment history.

Sra. Zulma S. has a store in her home where she offers all types of basic necessities to her neighbors. She wants to increase her income, but the only way for her to do this is to offer more products that are of higher quality. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy cleaning products, toiletries, office supplies, and other items.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning products, toiletries, office supplies, and other items.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane M. maintains a cattle farm, keeps beehives, and cultivates the land. Since 2009, Gayane has been a client of SEF, and with the help of the loans she has been able to access, she has been able to grow her business. 

Apart from owing her own land, Gayane also rents a portion of land. She needs additional financial resources to be able to cultivate it. This loan will cover the cost of the seeds that Gayane requires for the spring planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant in the spring

loans.name: Zokirjon

texts.ru: Султонов Зокиржон житель района Шахритус. Ему 45 лет. Он женат. Имеет троих детей. У него среднее образование. Он более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует участок земли, где сеет злаковые культуры. Целью кредита является покупка минеральных удобрений, топлива, семян арбуза и ячменя для посева.
texts.en: Zokirjon S. lives in Shahrituz. He is 45 years old, married, and has three children. He has a secondary education. He has been working in agriculture for more than six years. He rents a plot of land where he sows grain. He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel, watermelon seeds, and barley to plant.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel, watermelon seeds, and barley to plant.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, natural de la ciudad de San Miguel de 21 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Fraxides de 22 años y su querido hijo Henri de 05 años de edad, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Irma junto a su pareja en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingresos, es la venta de cacao, café, plátano y plantas de barbasco, las cuales vende en la ciudad de San Francisco. Irma en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros y de esa manera avanza con mayor celeridad en las extracciones de sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que su trabajo está dando sus frutos,  lleva 06 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la  plaga de insectos que atacan sus plantas. Con el tiempo desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y sin causar problemas a su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado comprará insecticidas para combatir la plaga de insectos.
texts.en:
Irma is from the city of San Miguel.  She is 21 years old, and she is a happy and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her 22 year old life partner, Fraxides, and her beloved five year old son, Henria.  She wishes to give him a better quality of life.

The arduous work that Irma does with Fraxides on her farm has made their crops well cared.  Therefore, her products are rapidly purchased on sale day.  Her main source of income is selling cacao, coffee, bananas, and mullein.  She sells her products in San Francisco.

At harvest time Irma hires day workers so that the products can be harvested more quickly.  What she likes the most about her work is harvesting her land because she feels that she is getting the fruit of her work.  She has been doing this for six years.  The most difficult part is taking care so the pest infestations do not attack the plants.  In time she wants to get more land to increase her crops.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual with her payments, and she has not caused any problems for her communal bank.  She will use the requested loan to buy insecticides to combat pest infestations.

loans.use: to buy insecticides.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married with 2 children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Sari-sari (variety) store for 7 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Josephine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is from the village of Lower Tiparak Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur. He is 22 years old. Gilbert is separated from his spouse and has one school-aged child. He owns and operates a business providing waste management services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a motorcycle transportation service. Gilbert has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month.

In 2011, Gilbert joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service. This will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle for better service

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anibal Enrique

texts.es:
Anibal Enrique tiene 33 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los dos hijos Xavier y Joselin. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Anibal se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es llegar a tener mas dinero para cuando lo9s hijos vayn a la escuela.

Le gusta hacer mucho deporte con los hijos.
texts.en:
Anibal Enrique is 33 years old, and he is married.  He lives with his wife and his two children, Xavier and Joselin.  They live in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

His Communal Bank is called San Francisco de Sibimbe.  It is located in the Sibimbe precint, which is in the Ventanas canton.  The communal bank has 20 members who grow short cycle corn and rice.

Anibal devotes himself to growing corn and rice.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month, and he sells at the fair in the same place.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers.  The support of the loan will help him financially in order to supply his necessities.  

His dream is to have more money for when the children go to school.

He really likes to play sports with his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa radica desD. hace 30 años en la ciudad D. Huancayo, es viuda y vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia. Tiene 21 años D. experiencia en el negocio, posee una tienda D. las cuales se ha mantenido a pesar D. los duros momentos que le ha tocado vivir, Su tienda actualmente es amplia, donD. tiene gran variedad D. productos, desD. frutas, carnes, granos productos envasados y algunos artículos D. limpieza y D. escritorio que ha implementado  para que sus clientes tengan mayores opciones a la hora D. consumir.  Para Rosa tener éste negocio ha sido y es una gran experiencia D. vida en la que aprendió  a ser más sociable y salir adelante para el bienestar D. su familia. Hoy tiene solidez por lo que tiene planes D. seguir ampliándola con más mercadería. Es la segunda vez que tiene crédito con MFP  D. la cuales considera que ha tomado una buena decisión, ya que desea aumentar su capital D. trabajo, asimismo sabe administrar sus ingresos para afrontar las cuotas D. pago y lo ha venido demostrando en todo este tiempo. En esta ocasión, el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. productos como arroz, azúcar y fideos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Rosa has lived in the city of Huancayo for 30 years.  She is a widow and lives with her three children in her own home.  She has 21 years experience in her business.  She owns a store which has kept her going in spite of the difficult moments that she has had to live through.  Her store is currently very large and she sells a wiD. range of products including fruit, meat, grains, canned goods, some cleaning products and some stationery products.  She has stocked her store so that her customers have more options when they shop.

For Rosa, having this business has been (and still is) a great life experience as she has learned to be more sociable and get ahead for her family's sake.  Her business is now sound and so she plans to continue expanding it with more merchandise. 

This is Rosa's second loan from MFP.  She considers that she maD. a good decision in working with MFP since she would like to increase her working capital.  She knows how to manage her income so that she can meet her loan repayments and she has shown this over time.  On this occasion, she will invest the money that she is requesting in buying products such as rice, sugar and noodles wholesale.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey has operated a matatu (motor vehicle) business for the past five years. His potential customers are passers-by and travelers. He faces a major challenge in the high costs of servicing his vehicle. Geoffrey dreams of purchasing another motor vehicle in the future.
 
Geoffrey and his wife have one child who is still too young for school. The family lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Geoffrey's greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan he has requested, Geoffrey plans to purchase construction materials, sand, and cement. He decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, sand, and cement

loans.name: Cesario

texts.en:
Cesario, a 50-year-old married father of five school-aged children, wants all of his children to finish their studies, as this is the only thing of value he can give to them. He has been a farmer for almost 30 years, raising crops and livestock, usually earning a net profit of P 40,000 per harvest season.

Now requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for rice production, Cesario's goal is to increase his rice production to earn more income to finance the school fees of his children. He believes that his efforts and sacrifices will someday bear fruit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for rice production.

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Clara, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en:
Kebbeh is 27 years old, married and lives in Congo Town. Her husband, a commercial driver, and she have one child who is four years old. 

For the past three years Kebbeh has been selling fish in the local market. She likes her job because she sells quality and very expensive fish and has a lot of customers.

Kebbeh is requesting a loan of 10,000 LRD to purchase six cartons of sardine fish to sell. She hopes to have her own fishing boat in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 6 cartoons of sardine fish for her business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 41-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 23 years old.

Luzviminda is a farmer working in Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She grows rice, corn and pineapples on her land. Luzviminda hopes to continue earning from her farm so she can sustain her children's education.

Luzviminda has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with two children, both of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a natural juice selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwanajuma dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruit for making juice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fruit for making juice for sale.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, D. 58 años, es una mujer amable y muy responsable, esta casada y tiene seis hijos quienes ya son mayores y solo dos viven con ella, un hijo D. 30 años, y su hija D. 26 años,  quien es madre soltera y vive ahí con su hijo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia que pudo comprar junto a su esposo para poder educar y criar a sus hijos.
El trabajo D. Nilda consiste en la venta D. abarrotes al por menor, ella se dedica al menudeo, tiene 15 años ejerciendo éste trabajo y gracias a ello logró educar a sus hijos e implementar muchas cosas en su casa. Asimismo posee la ayuda D. su hija, pero generalmente trabaja sola. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que  nunca deja D. tener clientes, gana un buen porcentaje en sus venta y eso hace que tenga ingresos regulares, por ahora ella prefiere mantenerse con lo que tiene y mas adelante poder ampliar un poco más su negocio. Este será el crédito diez con MFP, y considera que le gusta trabajar con su grupo, ya que son muy responsables, y espera poder seguir trabajando bien como hasta ahora, asimismo está muy agradecida con su ayuda anterior y espera seguir trabajando juntos nuevamente. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería y productos para su bodega y asi abastecerse D. más productos.
texts.en:
Nilda, 58, is a kind, very responsible woman.  She’s married and has six children who are all adults now, just two of them still live with her, a 30-year-old son and her 26-year-old daughter who is a single mother and lives there with her son.  They all live together in their own house that she and her husband were able to buy to educate and raise their children.

Nilda’s work consists in selling groceries at retail.  She’s a retailer.  She’s been in business for 15 years and thanks to it was able to educate her children and furnish her house with many things.  Her daughter helps her out but mostly she works alone.  What she likes about her work is that she never lacks customers.  She earns a good percentage on her sales and this causes her to have a regular income.  For now, she prefers to support herself with what she has and later on be able to enlarge her business a bit more.

This will be her tenth MFP loan and she feels that she likes to work with her group because they are very responsible and she hopes to continue working well like she’s done to date.  She is also very grateful for the previous help and hopes to continue to work together again.  She will use the requested amount to buy merchandise and products for her store in order to stock up on more products.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is aged 43 and has been in farming for over 10 years in his local home area in Litein in the South Rift of Kenya. He produces tea, milk and broilers for the local market.

Richards has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva partner, to buy poultry, both layers and broilers (birds for eggs and for meat respectively) . He says he wants to expand his poultry farming so that he can fully rely on it to cover the family needs, especially the education of his children. He is very optimistic the businesses will continue to improve.

However, he mentions the high cost of animal feeds as a great challenge.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS DE RUMICHACA ALTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cría chanchos y ovejas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego lo vende en el mercado y en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Urubamba, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ovejas y chanchos y también para comprar alimentos para los animales. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the "Manos Juntas de Rumichaca Alta" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Maribel is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising animals (pigs and sheep).  She fattens her animals and then sells them in the various markets in Urubamba district.  Through this business, she supports her children.  Maribel would like to expand her animal-raising business.  She is requesting this loan to buy sheep, pigs, and feed for the animals. 

Maribel is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy sheep, pigs, and animal feed

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 48 años, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus tres hijos y su nieto recién nacido, en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza, es la venta de medicinas a base de vegetales traídos de la amazonía, conocimiento que adquirió de su madre, y ahora ella lo aplica y los vende creándole así un negocio rentable, La preparación la realiza en su casa, y lo hace sola, por lo que ya tiene más de siete años, tiempo que le ha valido para hacerse conocid y tener muchos clientes. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder ayudar a muchas personas en el tratamiento de diversas enfermedades y saber que con su medicina alternativa se han sanado, esto le llena de orgullo. Tiene planes de industrializar su negocio, sabe que para poder lograr eso, se necesita de mucho trabajo y dedicación, y ella está convencida que podrá lograrlo. Este sería el primer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad brindada de poder tener un capital de trabajo para poder atender los pedidos que tiene en espera. Con el préstamo,  comprará plantas medicinales, raíces y cortezas para la preparación de remedios.
texts.en:
Betty, 48, is a woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She lives in her own home with her husband, her three children, and her newborn grandchild.

The work she does is selling medicines based on vegetables brought from the Amazon region.  She acquired this knowledge from her mother, and now she applies the knowledge and sells the medicines, creating a profitable business.  She prepares the medicines in her home and she works alone.  She has been doing this work for more than seven years, time that has been valuable to her for making herself known and getting a lot of customers.

What she likes about her job is being able to help a lot of people in treating various illnesses, and knowing that they have recovered with her alternative medicine.  This fills her with pride.  She is planning to develop her business.  She knows that, to be able to achieve this, she needs lots of work and dedication, and she is convinced that she will be able to do it.

This would be Betty's first loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity offered, to be able to have working capital to be able to deal with the requests that are waiting.

With the loan she will buy medicinal plants, roots, and bark to prepare remedies.

loans.use: to buy herbs, roots, and tree bark.

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Imee is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Imee has a hat-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her hat making business.

Imee has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials for her hat-making business.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 28-year-old single man from Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Sameer has a restaurant and he is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to purchase goods needed for expansion.

He is looking to open a new branch of his restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase goods needed to expand his restaurant

loans.name: Flavio Milton

texts.es:
Flavio Milton tiene 38 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos. Vive con la esposa Y con los hijos de 15 y 11 años de edad en el cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Flavio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz arroz hace 20 años. Las compras y las 
Ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la siembra de maíz y comprar los abonos y fertilizantes.

Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudara ha comprar los insumos sin ningún tipo de problema.

No se le ha presentado ningún problema en la agricultura.En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Flavio Milton is 38 years old, in a common law relationship and has two children.  He lives with his wife and children who are 15 and 11 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Las Palmas” communal bank are located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they are farmers.  Flavio is a farmer who has been growing rice and corn for 20 years.  His purchases and his sales take place in Ventanas.

He is asking for the loan to continue working his corn and rice crops and to buy fertilizer.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy supplies problem-free.  His dream is to be able to buy a tractor.  He has had no type of problem with the farming and in his free time he likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Yulduzoi

texts.ru: Юлдузой энергичная женщина, ей 36 лет. Она замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Юлдузой занимается купле продажей крупного рогатого скота. Она всю прибыль старается правильно распределить. Уделяет также много времени для воспитания детей. Она старается создать все условия для получения образования своих детей. Более 12 лет она трудится и продвигается вперед. Она четвертый раз кредитуется в «ИМОН Интернешнл» и от ранее полученных займов получила  хорошую прибыль. На прибыль купила мебель для своего дома. Теперь она хочет еще немножко улучшить свои жилищные условия и для этого ей необходимо расширить свой бизнес. Юлдузой запрашивает займ для покупки одной коровы и 2 голов овец. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Yulduzoi is an energetic 36-year old woman. She is married and a proud mother of four children. Yulduzoi raises and sells cattle. She allocates her profits carefully for various needs and spends a lot of time raising her children as well. It is very important for Yulduzoi to create an environment where her children will receive the best education and move on to a better life. Her livestock business has been going for more then 12 years and Yulduzoi had turned to "Imon International" four times already. The loans have been fully repaid and she was able to earn good profits from these ventures. Yulduzoi used the money to purchase new furniture and is planning to continue improving her family's living conditions in the future. Furthermore she wants to expand her herd again and is requesting this loan to purchase another cow and two more sheep. Yulduzoi is hoping for your support and would like to thank everyone in advance for their kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 54 years old. She is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman.

Margarita has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years. She works hard to support her family and to sustain her children's education. She has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and hooks and to pay for school fees. Margarita hopes to acquire an additional fishing boat soon.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and hooks and to pay for school fees

loans.name: Yeimi Astrid

texts.es:
Yeimi es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 1 hijo de 6 años de edad, quien siempre ha sido su motivación para esforzarse en su trabajo. Yeimi, a pesar de las dificultades que le ha presentado la vida, ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando junto a su hijo. Yeimi se dedica desde hace aproximadamente 9 años a la venta de ropa, la cual le ha permitido generar los ingresos necesarios para sostener los gastos de su hogar y ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Gracias a la buena atención que ofrece Yeimi, su negocio es bastante reconcido, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas. La gran dificultad que tiene Yeimi es la falta de capital para poder atender los grandes pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Con el ánimo de tener un inventario más grande para poder responder a los grandes pedidos que hacen sus clientes, Yeimi busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de ropa para aumentar su inventario de mercancía y estar preparada para responder a los grandes pedidos de sus clientes.

Yeimi espera poder aumentar su inventario sin que sus ingresos mensuales se vean afectados, además, espera que su negocio siga generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Yeimi sueña con ver su hijo en una educación de calidad y en un futuro accediendo a una educación universitaria.

loans.use: Compra de ropa para aumentar su inventario de mercancía y estar preparada para responder a los grandes pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.name: Qory Orcco-Pucyura Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal QORY ORCCO - PUCYURA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Pucyura  en la provincia  de Anta departamento de Cusco.
La socia Paulina tiene 52 años de edad es soltera tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias al negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva años en este su negocio administrándolo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cuyes y alimentos.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, agricultura, ganadería, venta de granos secos, panadería, crianza de animales menores, venta de verduras.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y salud.
La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the QORY ORCCO – PUCYURA communal bank. This bank is located in the Pucyura district in the Anta province of the Cusco department.

Paulina is 52 years old, single and has 2 children. She alternates her daily work activities in the business of raising small animals. For years she has been administering to this business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts in each day. She raises her little animals in order to then sell them to the customers who ask. In this way she moves her family forward. She is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs and feed.

The other members earn a living from agriculture, a bakery, raising cattle and small animals and selling clothing, dry grains and vegetables.

The member shown in the attached photograph asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons. 

She is thankful for the loan granted and is committed to fulfilling the set payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed.

loans.name: Diantoyerela  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  6 membres du groupe  DIANTOYERELA  2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  FALABA un des villages de Dogo 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4ème prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée à l’image de  SOUKOURA, 4ème personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de  FALABA après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  46.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Flor De Maravillas 1 Group

texts.es:
Blanca is twenty three years old, has three children. She began studying since she was six, her family only could give her the opportunity to study to fifth grade, and this was because she has eleven siblings. She was forced to work at the age of ten years old, she worked in a farm cutting cardamom and coffee.
Blanca suffered a lot with her parents, she decided to marry at the age of fourteen. Now with the help of her husband they are doing better. She does not go to harvest coffee and cardamom any more and with their business they began to get a better life.
They buy and sell coffee, with their income they pay for the credit and the interests. She say they are getting a better life quality, their children are studying and now they give them a better feeding and a better health.
Now she live negotiating coffee and caring for their children.
Blanca is the leader of Flor de Maravillas Group (Flower of Wanders). The group is integrated by six women, one is Qánjob’al Maya ethnicity and five are Ladinos. The group will invest their loans for agriculture 67% and in retail 33%. On average each member of the group has six children. Their average age is thirty four. 83% of the group is illiterate, and 17% could not end their primary education. Their average amount of their loans is GTQ 2,881.

loans.use: To buy more coffee for selling it.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Mrs. Rosemary O. lives in a semi-urban area in Edo State, and is married with seven children.  She learnt her trade for three months and started her business in the year 1990. She asks for the above amount for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Faamata

texts.en: Faamata joined the SPBD Program in 2004, and she was elected Secretary of SPBD’s Siuniu Center.  Most of her family moved to New Zealand, and Faamata and her husband struggle to survive and support their four children in Samoa without relying on remittances.  Three years ago, Faamata applied for her first loan of ST 750 (approximately USD 300), and she used that money to buy chemicals, fertilizers and other supplies for the taro plantation that she keeps near her house.  Faamata’s taro farm represents the main source of income for her family.  Having repaid her initial loans and raised her family’s living standard with the income from the expanded taro plantation, Faamata is committed to continuing to invest in her business.  Faamata is seeking an additional SPBD loan for two purposes:  to buy supplies and equipment for the taro farm and to make necessary repairs to the floor of her house.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and equipment and make home improvements

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun C., 28 years old, married and a mother of 2 children who attend school, lives with her husband in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To service the family's expenses, she works at a local garment factory and typically makes about $3/day in revenue, while her husband works as a construction foreman as well as raising animals and growing crops in his field.

In order to maximize her livestock, Soeun C. is asking for $600 to purchase cows to raise in her field. She hopes after five to six months breeding, her family's savings will be increased so that she can afford to add more cows for her livestock and use the leftover money to build a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase  cows  to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde is 34 years old and has two children. She is an artisan who makes tablecloths, napkins, cushions, shawls, blouses, and she sells them in a nearby town or in the city where the tourises buy traditional regional arts and crafts. She is part of the Neblina 3 group with two other artisans, Maria Pérez Pérez y Maria Martínez Pérez. With the loan they will invest in the purchase of various colored thread at wholesale prices.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MATILDE tiene 34 años, dos hijos. Ella es artesana hace manteles, servilletas, cojines, chales, blusas y los vende en el pueblo mas cercano o en la ciudad en donde llegan turistas que compran artesanías típicas que caracterizan a cada pueblo. Forma parte del grupo llamado Neblina 3 junto con doña Maria Pérez Pérez (artesana) y doña Maria Martínez Pérez (artesana). Con la parte de sus prestamos invertirán en la compra de hilos en diversos colores al por mayor.

loans.use: Purchase thread

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru:
Nurali S. is 22 years old and has a secondary education. Nurali owns a business at the Tidzhorat market in Yavan. He has been selling fabrics for women’s clothing for 8 years. Nurali plans to use the loan to purchase new kinds of fabric for making autumn, ethnic, women’s clothing.

Because ethnic fabrics are in demand in Tajikistan, the residents of the Yavan region will be able to purchase fabrics at the local market without having to leave their city and the prices will be comparable to those at the wholesale market in Dushanbe, which is 80 kilometers away and where Nurali travels to purchase his products. Nurali plans to pay the loan back over an 8 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Саидов Нурали, возраст – 22 лет, образование среднее. Саидов Нурали имеет торговую точку на одном из рынков города Явана под названием «Тиджорат». Бизнес которым он занимается уже в течение 8 лет – это продажа тканей для пошимва женской одежды. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести новый вид тканей для пошива осенней женской национальной одежды. Так как в Республике Таджикистан большим спросом пользуются ткани национального характера, жители данного района смогут приобретать ткани на местном рынке, не выезжая за пределы города, при этом цены на ткани почти схожие с ценами на оптовом рынке в городе Душанбе, находящийся на расстояние 80 км, где производит закуп товара Саидов Нурали. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal products

loans.name: Afefa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aféfa T. is 32 and a married mother of three children. She buys boxes of candy wholesale at the market in Lomé and then sells them retail at the Assahoun market and at the markets in the neighboring villages on market day. The income she earns from this business allows her to help pay her family’s expenses. She would like to increase her supplies, especially in time for the holidays, so that she can satisfy her customers’ demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Aféfa T. est agée de 32 ans ,mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle achète en gros les paquets de bonbons au marché de Lomé et les revend en détail au marché d'Assahoun et dans les marchés des villages d'Assahoun le jour des marchés. Cette activité lui procure des revenus et elle contribue aux charges de fonctionnement de la famille. Elle désire augmenter son étallage surtout en cette période de fête afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle

loans.use: Purchase of 25 boxes of candy in Lomé to resell them in Assahoun

loans.name: Mulyati

texts.en: Mulyati, 31, is the mother of 2 children. Her husband, R., does not have any job, so to earn income for her family she sells salty (pickled) eggs. Every day she processes duck eggs into salty eggs at her house then sells them at the market, earning about US$ 10 a day. She is asking for a loan of US$ 75 to expand her business and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her pickled-egg business

loans.name: Nazar

texts.ru:
Nazar S. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 40 years old, a widower, and has 2 children. He has a specialized High School education - he is a trained construction worker. He works at a construction site, but in addition to that resells cattle. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. He purchase calves in his own village and sells them on the market for the the Rudaki region. This system of purchase and resale allows the inhabitants of the Rudaki region to purchase animals without spending money on travel. This business also allows to improve the financial situation of the S. family. Nazar plans to repay the loan in a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Житель района Рудаки.Вдовец имеет 2 детей.Возраст 40 лет. Образование средне-специальное. По специальности строитель. Зарабатывает работая на стройке.Кроме того занимается купле-продажей Крупно рогатого скота.Занимается этим бизнесом уже 5 лет.Скупает бычков в собственном кишлаке и реализует на рынке района Рудаки. Эта система скупки позволяет населению кишлака не тратиться на транспорт.Кроме того занятие торговлей КРС позволяет улучшить финансовое положение в семье.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is married with two grown children. She lives in Simferopol and runs a vending business in the central city market. Gulnara sells jeans and women’s outer wear. Several other family members work with her in this business. They help her with sales as Gulnara owns four vending kiosks and needs much help. She has been in this trade for four years.

Gulnara is very purpose-driven and enterprising. She never stops where she’s at but tries to press on and move forward with her business endeavors. Today Gulnara is requesting a loan of $1000 to restock her merchandise and possibly open a new vending location. She is hoping to generate enough profit to provide her kids with separate apartments one day. This is one of her biggest dreams and goals in life.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Amina's Endelevu Group

texts.en:
Amina is 35 years old and is married with 3 children, aged 16, 14 and 10. Amina is a charcoal seller, which she started doing in 2006. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Anna, Prisca, and Nest, who have businesses dealing in charcoal sales, food vending, and owning a shop.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Julieta Elena

texts.es:
Julieta is married with 2 children, 8 and 2. She started the business because she's always wanted to have one, separate from her job, that would provide an extra income for her family. She started the business more than six years ago and it's worked for her because she knew that she could combine it with the job that she still has. Julieta's husband has always supported her efforts to get ahead and helps her operate the mini-mart and be there when she can't. That's a big help because her job is demanding and she doesn't always have the chance to see to the business.

Julieta is applying for a US$975 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to stock her store because she's out of some indispensable items. With your help, Julieta will continue to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Julieta es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 2 años. Inició el negocio porque siempre ha tenido el interés de manejar su propio negocio a parte del trabajo que tiene, ya que esto le da la opción de tener un ingreso extra para solventar los gastos de su familia. Comenzó hace mas de seis años con el negocio y le ha funcionado porque ha sabido combinarlo a la par con el trabajo que actualmente tiene, además su esposo siempre la ha apoyado mucho a salir adelante y el se encarga también de administrar el mini súper y de estar al tanto de lo que hace falta, porque en ocasiones si es mucha la carga de trabajo y no siempre tiene la oportunidad de ver las necesidades del negocio.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir de mercancía la tienda ya que le faltan algunos productos que son indispensables. Con tu apoyo Julieta seguirá adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel A. is not married. He is thirty years old and has been a local producer of polytin (rubber) bags for the past ten years. Daniel is a young man with the vision to serve humanity with his talent and skills. He dreams of a well established company of his own from which to produce the bulk of polytin bags to serve all kinds of purposes. He produces and supplies to food vendors, market sellers and super market operators to wrap bought items for their customers. Daniel is constrained by capital from producing on a large scale to meet the demands of his customers. He wants to use the loan to buy a large quantity of rubbers and another machine to facilitate his production and meet demand. He belongs to the community group called “Nyame Bekyere” (God will provide) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of rubbers and a machine.

loans.name: Ket

texts.en:
Mrs. Ket C. is a broom-maker. Her husband transports the brooms to the local market to sell. Together they earn around $5 per day. The couple has three children, all of whom are in school. The family lives in Chmkar Samrong Village, Battambang Province.

Because their income is not sufficient to support the family’s expenses, she wants to pursue an additional business of oxen rental. Mrs. C. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase an ox. She will then be able to rent out the ox to local farmers that need it to plow their fields, but cannot afford to purchase and take care of an ox on their own. By pursuing this business venture she hopes to increase her family income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase an ox

loans.name: Sruy

texts.en:
This is the second time for Mrs. Sruy I. to take a loan in order to improve her living conditions. She is a farmer who cultivates twice a year in the field which located in Pro Theat Village in Kandal Province. Although Mrs. Sruy I. tries to cultivate twice a year, she still has a little revenue, so she now wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sruy I. decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land in order to cultivate rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Yoen ThI., is a laborer who can make a small income to support his family.

Mrs. Sruy I. is 38 years old and the mother of five children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory while three more are attending school. The remaining one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture because Mrs. Sruy I. is very busy with her work.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land in order to cultivate rice and vegetables

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent E. sells a variety of drinks at Elmina. Millicent has received a teacher training college education. She is single and has no children. Millicent has been selling drinks since 1993. She is responsible for paying rent and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy different kinds of drinks to be supplied to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring her own house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy different kinds of drinks to be supplied to her customers.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha H. is 39 years old and lives in Prek Preah Sdach Commune, Battambang Province. She works as a civil servant for the agricultural ministry, while her husband, Mr. Chhaya Rut, 40, is a soldier. Their income combines to approximately US$8 per day. Sokha has three children, all of whom are young students and stay at home, and she is responsible for their children's school fees and the family's expenses. To generate another source income, Sokha needs a loan to grow a vegetable crop to sell, such as green beans, corn, and pumpkin. Hence, she would like to request a loan of US$300 from Kiva to purchase seeds to grow and spend for growing activities. :

Sokha was selected to be a small group leader of three members as following: Mrs. Thy H. is a used cloths seller. She requested a loan of US$100 to purchase more used cloths to sell. Mrs. Ly C. raises pigs. She requested a loan of US$150 to purchase pig foods to fatten her pigs to sell.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses so they can provide a better life for their families.

loans.name: Tong

texts.en:
Mr. Tong A., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Tin Ry, 38, live on National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. All of their three sons are in school, and the daughter is employed full-time.

Tong has been a motor taxi driver for 18 years, and he also raises cows. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to school

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en:
Tawa lives in Ilogbo, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells plastic items such as plates, cups, and coolers. Tawa is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes to expand her business by purchasing more plastic items to sell.

Tawa is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more plastic articles to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic articles to sell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch D. lives in Kok village, in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer, who earns a small revenue from a tiny piece of land where she cultivates rice. She now wants to expand her rice growing revenue and has decided to ask for a loan, which along with her savings will buy a additional plot of land to grow rice. Her husband, Mr. Nai Thol, helps her with the rice planting  Mrs. Touch D. is 50 years old and the mother of five children; one is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: Requesting a loan to buy a plot of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: Мирзоев Исматулло живет в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 32 года , женат и имеет троих детей. Имеет высшее образование. По специальности журналист. Но по профессии не работает. Для того ,чтобы обеспечить свою семью занялся бизнесом. Торгует коврами на центральном рынке. Товар привозит из Ирана. Кредит планирует получить для, того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 9 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ismatullo M. lives in the Gissar region. He is 32 years old, married and has three children. He has high education and has a degree in journalism. He does not work by his profession. To be able to support his family he started his own business. He sells rugs on the central market which he brings in from Iran. He plans to use the loan to increase the circulation of his goods. He will pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase circulation

loans.name: Luzmienda

texts.en:
Luzmienda L., 56, is a widow with five children, all married --  one of whom is working abroad, two were not able to finish college. 

She lives in a small barrio of Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Her main source of income is duck-raising. She started with 20 ducks and has grown the business with 350 ducks.  She sells duck eggs to the neighboring localities. 

She had already nine loan availments from PMPC. With the Kiva loan, she wants to buy more ducks to produce eggs thus, increasing her profit as well.  

She hopes to help her married children financially, the other two (2) to finish college and enough money to get her by when she gets old and could no longer work.

loans.use: Additional capital in purchasing ducks

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora María P. se ha destacado por ser una excelente comerciante teniendo su propia pulpería que ha logrado levantar a raíz de muchos sacrificios en su localidad.

Desde que inició el negocio vendía pocos productos pero al paso de los años ha desarrollado su negocio y esto se lo debe a los créditos brindados por Ceprodel. Hoy en día solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de los productos y de esta forma salir adelante para su desarrollo personal.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandega, María P. has distinguished herself as an excellent entrepreneur, having succeeded in bringing her grocery store to fruition after many sacrifices. She began selling very few products, but after a few years she has developed her business, which is why she has earned credit with Ceprodel. She is now soliciting a loan to buy more products so she can move even further in her personal development.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Zaini

texts.en:
Zaini S. is married with six children, adults and younger, who live with him. He works in the agriculture and livestock industry. His strength is in raising livestock, but he is dedicated to cultivating his crops through fumigation and care in order to obtain a good harvest. He would like to invest in his livestock business by purchasing cows to obtain milk for sustenance and commercialization. He seeks support from IMON International to help him move his business forward. With your help, Zaini can get ahead.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

loans.use: Purchase young cattle

loans.name: Konsulo

texts.ru: Консуло – 35 лет. Она замужем и мать 4-х детей. Её мж уехал в Россию работать. Здесь он не смог найти хорошую работу, чтобы накопить денег и купить для себя скот. У Консулло было всего лишь 4 барана. Но недавно она узнала о кредитовании нашей организации, и пришла брать кредит для покупки одной дойной коровы. Консулло будет доить молоко и давать детям. Если останется она будет продавать. Пока ее муж найдет работу в России и пришлет ей деньги, ей будет помогать ее брат.
texts.en:
Konsulo is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 children. Her husband went to Russia for work. Here he could not find a good job that would allow him to save money and purchase livestock for himself. Konsulo only had 4 sheep, but recently she found out about credit from our organization and came to take out a loan for the purchase of one dairy cow. Konsulo will milk the cow and give the milk to her children. If there are leftovers, she will sell them. Until her husband finds a job in Russia and sends money, her brother will help her.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Gafforchon

texts.ru:
Гаффорчон Сидиков торгует на Бадахшанском рынке Зафарабадского района. Продает одежду для детей и для взрослых. Начал он заниматься этим бизнесом год назад. На прибыль полученную от торговли он содержит свою семью. Гаффорчону 31 год, женат на Шахнозе Сидиковой.
  Планирует расширить и разнообразить ассортимент своего товара, с этой целью обратился к нам за помощью.
  Ему нужна сумма в размере 2000 сомони, сроком на 8 месяцев. Он считает что данная сумма, вполне сможет помочь ему, для достижения вышеуказанной цели, а достаток в семье завести ребенка.
texts.en:
Gafforchon Sadikov runs a business at the Badahshan market in Zafarabad district. He sells clothing for both children and adults, and opened the business a year ago. He supports his family on the profits from this trade. Gafforchon is 31 years old, and he is married to Shahnoza Sidikova. He plans to expand and diversify his selection of goods, and with that goal in mind turned to MicroInvest for assistance. He needs an eight-month loan in the amount of 2000 somoni. He thinks that amount will help him to fully achieve both the above-mentioned goal, and that of having a child.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
"In everything you do, put God first and you will somehow (be) directed and someday become successful,” said Prescilla D. V. of Barangay Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Villamore and they were blessed with eight children. Being responsible parents, six of their children have already graduated from college and the youngest two are still studying. They want to give them the best education they can because it is the only treasure that they are able to give to their children. Hence, they are striving hard to support the studies of their two children.

Her husband cultivates their small farm for two cropping seasons, planting rice and vegetables, while Prescilla is engaged in the vending business of food to help her husband support the education of their two children. She wanted to borrow a loan from lenders amounting to PHP12,000 as additional working capital. She will use the loan to improve her enterprise. She hopes to become successful by utilizing the loan wisely and by persevering toward the development of her business.

loans.use: Business capital

location.town: Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gladis Josefina

texts.es: Gladis Josefina C. V. D. M., vive en San Martín ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Gladis es una mujer D. 46 años D. edad madre D. cinco hijos D. los cuales dos ya son mayores D. edad y trabajan como profesores, y los otros hijos D. Gladis siguen estudiando. Gladis es una madre muy comprometida con su familia ha trabajado 23 años en su negocio que es una tienda, con la cual ha logrado sacar adelante a todos sus hijos motivándolos a estudiar y ser unos profesionales, hoy Gladis solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar productos para venta por mayoreo D. esta manera lograría mayor margen D. ganancias.
texts.en:
Gladis Josefina C. V. D. M. lives in San Martín, located in the district of San Salvador. Gladis is a 46-year-old mother of five children, two of which are grown and work as teachers. The other children are currently students.

Gladis is a very engaged mother. With her family, she has worked for 23 years in her store, which has successfully motivated her children to move forward with their studies and to become professionals.

Today, Gladis is requesting a loan because she wants to buy products to sell at wholesale, and in this manner would manage to increase her profit margins.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale products

loans.name: Leonore

texts.en:
Leonore A. owns a small rice field. She is 29 years old and has three children. Her husband, Rufel A., is the one managing their business. The harvest from their farm goes a long ways to help pay tuition and other school expenses of their children. Some of their income is used to provide for their basic needs.

Their dream is to acquire another hectare of farm land. This is what her heart is pushing her to do. Now, she needs a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy the needed fertilizers and pesticides.

In all of Leonore's business endeavors, CEVI has been giving support to make the business grow. She receives training and insurance coverage as well loans.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, ammonium, pesticides and other farming supplies

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita S. is from the village of Sta Ana, in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Juanita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Juanita is starting a business venture in the personal use sector selling personal use products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal use products to local community members. Juanita is just starting this business.

In 2009, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase  products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Juanita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase personal use products to sell

loans.name: Kwamba Kafui

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des objets plastiques, sa clientèle est en majorité féminine. Elle accueille ses clients avec beaucoup d’attention  ce qui fait que ses clients reviennent toujours acheter chez elle. Elle fait face en ce moment à une rupture de stock, pour s’approvisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 plats plastiques, 10 gobelets et divers objets plastiques.
texts.en:
This woman sells plasticware. Most of her clientele is made up of women. She waits on her customers attentively so her customers often come back to buy from her. She is presently out of stock and to replenish her inventory, she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 15 plastic trays, 10 drinking cups and various other plastic items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of objects made of plastic for resale

loans.name: Gloria Evelyn

texts.es: Gloria Evelyn V. D. LandaverD. resiD. en Santa Tecla municipio D. La Libertad. Gloria tiene 52 años D. edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo Arturo y sus tres hijos, todos estudiantes. Gloria ha trabajado gran parte D. su vida en la confección D. ropa para cama, accesorios D. baño y  también elaborando ropa a la medida; con dieciocho años D. experiencia Gloria ha ganado una clientela my estable. El crédito que solicita Gloria es para comprar gran cantidad en telas y listones, ya que se aproximan las fechas en que elabora vestidos típicos para las fechas cívicas en el mes D. septiembre y necesita tener suficiente materia prima para no fallarle a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria Evelyn V. D. LandaverD. lives in the Santa Tecla municipality in La Libertad. Gloria is 52. She lives in her own house with her husband, Arturo, and their three children. All of her children are students. Gloria has worked a large part of her life making bedding, bath accessories, and also making custom clothing. With 18 years of experience, she has gained a very stable customer base. The loan that Gloria is asking for is to buy a large quantity of fabric and ribbons. The time is approaching when she makes typical clothing for the civic celebrations in the month of September. She needs to have enough raw material so that she will not let her customers down.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric to make clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other agricultural inputs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn D.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 20 years old and single, living in the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. Marilyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This will be Marilyn's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes in bulk

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is from the village of Purok 3, San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 68 years old and married. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,942 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Vong V. is a 37-year-old father of five teenage children, all of whom are in school. His wife raises poultry and grows rice. Since early 2005, he has made a living both driving a taxi and working in construction. He normally earns around $4 of income per day to support his family and buy them food. Vong V. will use his loan to construct a toilet for his family's hygiene. 

Note: Vong V.'s wife appears in the photograph

loans.use: To construct a toilet for his family's hygiene

loans.name: Sundur

texts.en:
A. Sundur is 39 years old. He learned his profession of cattle farming from his father when he was young. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more. In addition to raising animals, Sundur also runs a taxi driver service in his free times.

With his previous loans, Sundur purchased one cattle. He sold it already and purchased two young calves, which he is rearing to sell. Today he wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. From the profit of his business, Sundur wants to educate his children at the university in the future. With your help this will be possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.
