In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase small cattle

loans.name: David Muchoki

texts.en:
David is a 35-year-old man who is married to Millicent. They have one son and three daughters aged 11 years, 9 years, 1 year and 6 months. David has been operating a general shop business for the past year and he does his business at Gatukuyu shopping centre in his home town. His customers are members of the local community.

He has no loan history with other microfinance institutions. He has planned to purchase more stock for his shop. He intends to save his profit to access a bigger loan.

His future hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop. He describes himself as an ambitious man with a vision that only needs his continuous hard work.

loans.use: To add stock in his retail shop like rice, cooking oil, biscuits and many more

loans.name: Alcida

texts.es:
Alcida tiene 42 años, vive muy contenta con su esposo (Velamino) de 50 años, y con sus dos jóvenes hijos: Gisela de 20 y Silvio de 18 años, en su acogedora casa (propia) ubicada en una apacible zona de la sierra del Perú.

Los días de esta luchadora mujer empiezan desde muy temprano, ya que debe ir a vigilar sus tierras y sembrarlas con mucho cuidado, ella cultiva papa, maíz y también flores (gladiolos), los cuales vende a muy buen precio a sus compradores mayoristas de la ciudad.
Generalmente hace su trabajo sola, aunque a veces, en las labores agrícolas, la ayuda su esposo. Alcida manifiesta que aprendió desde muy joven a trabajar la tierra y que luego cuando tuvo su familia no dudo en seguir con la siembra; así junto a su esposo han logrado que sus dos hijos estudien y están muy orgullosos por lo logrado. 
Esta labor es algo sacrificada, pero muy provechosa al final, ya que después de días de ardua trabajo pueden vender lo que buenamente la tierra  les produce.
Para el futuro, esta simpática señora tiene planes de sembrar en mayor cantidad sus productos para que sus ganancias sean mejores.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura de ser puntual y responsable en cada uno de sus pagos, ya que quiere seguir sacando adelante a sus hijos para descansar tranquila en el futuro. Con el dinero que solicita comprará varios sacos de semilla de papa y gladiolos, además de guano y fertilizantes para que la cosecha sea fructífera.
texts.en:
Alcida is 42 years old and lives happily with her husband Velamino (50) and their two young children, Gisela (20) and Silvio (18) in their lovely home, which is located in a peaceful area of the sierras of Peru. The work day of this hardworking woman begin early since she must be vigilant of her land and sow carefully. She plants potatoes, corn and Gladioli, which she sells at good prices to her customers, wholesalers in the city. Usually, she works alone, but sometimes her husband helps her with the agriculture work. Alcida says she learned at a young age to work the land, and after she started a family, she did not hesitate to continue this work. She and her husband have managed to put their kids through school, an accomplishment of which they are very proud. This work is difficult, but fulfilling at the end. After days of hard work, they can sell what the land produces for them. In the future, this lovely lady plans to increase her harvest to better her income. This is the first loan she is requesting from Kiva partner MFP, and she assures us she will be responsible and make her payments timely because she wants to continue providing for her children and ensuring a good future for herself. With the loan proceeds, she will buy several bags of potato and Gladioli seeds, guano, and fertilizer to ensure a fruitful harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Lorenzo G. le está haciendo falta el techo de enfrente de la vivienda ya que el actual está en muy malas condiciones y tiene miedo que pueda pasar un accidenté a su familia. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así poder poner el techo de concreto para que sea más duradero y segura para sus hijos. 
Don Lorenzo tiene mas de diez años con su negocio de herrería, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia y con el cual planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
The roof on the front of Lorenzo G.'s house is in such poor condition that he is afraid his family could be injured by it. For this reason he is asking for funding to install a concrete roof that will last longer and be safer for his children. Lorenzo has had an iron-working shop for over 10 years and this is his family's sole source of income. He will use part of his earnings to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a roof on the front of the house.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Mrs. N., 48, is a humble woman who currently lives with other family members in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is married with four children. Two of her sons are employed: one is a taxi driver and the other works in Malaysia.  The remaining two children are going to school. 

Her husband helps to support the family by driving a motor taxi (he appears in the photo.)  N. is a requirement laborer. She gets many pieces of cloth from the garment industry and she prepares them as sets of each size for a fee (the cloth is used to upholster furniture.) 

N. has a son who is jobless and she proposes to encourage him to learn the skill of repairing mobile phones, but he is unable to pay the school fee. Because N. has no money, she decided to ask for a loan of $1200 which will allow her to both pay the school fee and to buy a computer for her school-aged children.

loans.use: To pay school fees and buy a computer

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent owns a boutique where he sells clothes, like trousers and shirts. He is 28 years old and single without children. He hopes to get married very soon. Vincent hopes and aspires to grow and expand his business. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more clothes to sell and attract more profits. He has a good relationship with LAPO. He is itching for a significant expansion in his business. He says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en: Ma. Gina C., 44 years old, is a fish vendor. Her husband is a fisherman. She has five children and her eldest is already 29. She wants to improve her livelihood so that she can accommodate the needs of her family. She would like to request a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fishing materials and bait.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials and bait

loans.name: Kène

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  Kène G.  est couturière de métier depuis 2 ans. Agée  de 26 ans, Mademoiselle Kène G. trouve sa principale activité dans la vente de divers produits (tissus, produits cosmétiques…etc)  dans sa cantine sise au marché de Thiès depuis 2008. C’est l’amour du commerce et le goût des produits qui l’on poussé dans ce secteur. Ainsi, pour renforcer et développer son commerce, Mademoiselle Kène G. solliciter un prêt d’un montant  150 000 FCFA au niveau de sa caisse UIMCEC à laquelle, elle est devenue membre depuis Octobre 2008.
texts.en:
Miss Kène G. has been a seamstress for the past two years. She is 26 years old. Her main activity since 2008 has been the retail of various products (fabrics, beauty products, etc.) in her Thies market shop. She was attracted to this area of activity through her love of commerce and the products she sells. To strengthen and expand her business, Miss Kène G. has requested a 150,000 FCFA loan from the local U-IMCEC branch, of which she is a member since October 2008.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and expand her business

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter, Maralmaa, is a secondary school student and her husband works at a stone factory.

Narantuya operates a hat manufacturing business in her town. She produces a variety of hats including fur hats in the winter, woolen hats during the spring and autumn months, and Mongolian traditional hats during the summer. She has been operating her business since 2007, and has steadily expanded her business over the last two years. Narantuya learned to make hats from her sister and previously worked as a salesperson in a local market for six years between 2000-2006. She has good communication skills and is focused on improving her business in the future. She says, “I would like to expand my business.” Narantuya is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to increase her working capital and purchase more materials for her hat manufacturing business.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg is 51 years old and lives with his wife in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son, Myagmarsuren, is 20 years old and has been working in Korea for two years since he graduated from the university in Mongolia. In addition, he has 16-year-old daughter and 13-year-old son. 

During the day, Erdenechimeg manufactures iron products to sell to his many customers. He worked as a solderer in a collective farm between 1975 and 1990. Since 1990, he has been operating his own iron products and soldering business, and has steadily expanded his business. Erdenechimeg has extensive skills in manufacturing iron products and has became popular among local residents. With his earnings, he was able to pay his oldest son's university tuition fee. He and his family are honest people. His family and business are both important for him. Erdenechimeg says, “The most important thing to me is to be financially able to pay my children's education fees until they graduate and to support them in the future.” He is requesting a loan to purchase more iron to manufacture stoves and chimneys for gers.

loans.use: To purchase more iron

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La Sra.  Julia es nacida en la cuidad de Cochabamba de 53 años de edad, se vino de la ciudad de Cochabamba, buscando trabajo y conocio con el que ahora es su esposo y se quedo a vivir en Santa Cruz, ya radica en esta cuidad hace mas de 20 años en donde conformo su familia que esta compuesta por su esposo y dos hijos, actualmente vive en alquiler en el barrio los claveles de la zona Pampa de la Isla, es una persona muy amable, se dedica a la venta de verduras, esta actividad lo realiza ambulando calle por calle la mercaderia es transportada en un Carreton jalado por un par de caballos, los cuales facilitan su trabajo, su esposo el Sr. Hernan se dedica a la albañileria en su mismo barrio, el prestamo solictado sera para aumentar su mercaderia, e ir juntando de poco a poco para la compra de un lote y luego construir su propia casa, nos comenta que esta muy agradecida con nuestra institucion por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Julia, 53, was born in the city of Cochabamba. She left there looking for work and met her present husband in Santa Cruz; she has lived in this city for over 20 years and it is here that she formed her family composed of her husband and two children. She rents her home in the Los Claveles neighborhood in Pampa de la Isla zone. She is a very kind person who sells vegetables from a wagon pulled by two horses through the city streets; the horses make her work much easier. Her husband, Hernan, is a bricklayer in his neighborhood. She is asking for funds to increase her stock merchandise and to save up little by little to buy a lot on which to build their own house. She comments that she is very grateful with our institution for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegebables.

loans.name: Assoupi

texts.fr:
Cette femme de 31 ans est très dynamique. Infirmière de profession, pour faciliter l’accès aux populations de base, elle est aussi revendeuse de produits pharmaceutiques. 
Pour les besoins de son activité, elle a aménagé une boutique dénommée Jehovah Rapha où elle sert les produits pharmaceutiques aux habitants du quartier.
Le présent crédit est destiné à l’achat de 03 cartons de produits pour répondre plus promptement aux besoins sanitaires des populations.
texts.en:
This 31-year-old woman is very energetic. A nurse by profession, she is also a retailer of pharmaceuticals in order to facilitate access for people. For business reasons, she has fixed up a shop called Jehovah Rapha, where she provides pharmaceutical products to the residents of the district. The present loan is for buying three boxes of these products to respond promptly to the health needs of the people.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Liliana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Tongorrape, una zona rural del distrito de Motupe, conocido a nivel nacional por sus festividades religiosas, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora y veinte minutos  de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años y medio a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una  bodega ubicada en su vivienda, el negocio ha ido progresando gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, ella siempre ha ofrecido a sus clientes productos de buena calidad y buen trato. La bodega goza de muy buena acogida ya que la zona queda lejos del pueblo de Motupe y los pobladores no tienen acceso facil a productos de consumo diario.

Con los ingresos que percibe, Liliana apoya a su esposo a sostener la economía de su familia, su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola en un fundo de la zona. Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas artículos para ofrecerlos en venta y de esa manera ampliar sus ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo hasta convertirse en comerciante mayorista. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Liliana, 27, is married and has a son. She lives with her family in the Tongorrape settlement, in the rural area of the Motupe district. This area is known at the national level for its religious festivals. It is part of the Lambayeque province, and is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. For 2 and a half years, she has been selling basic necessities and groceries in a store located in her home. She has been making progress with her business, thanks to her effort and dedication. She always has offered her customers a good deal on high quality products. The store has been well-received, since the area is far from the town of Motupe, and the population does not have easy access to the consumer products used on a daily basis. With the income that she earns, Liliana helps her husband to support the family. Her husband works as an agricultural field hand for a company in the area. She wants to expand her business by purchasing more items to offer for sale, and in this way increase her earnings. To achieve this, she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles. Her main wish is to continue to grow to the point where she can become a wholesale merchant. She has worked previously with our institution, and has demonstrated that she is a punctual client who is responsible in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries and products that are basic necessities to expand her business

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng O. (wife in photo) is a 42-year-old married man and father. He lives with other family members in his small home in Kompong Tom Province.  He owns a piece of land that he inherited from his grandmother.  Eng and his wife grow different kinds of crop on the land, like potato, cucumbers and rice that he sells to customers.  They have four kids.  Eng O. is taking out his first loan to purchase insecticide, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: Purchase insecticide, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Luciana Zunilda

texts.es:
La señora Luciana Zunilda R. , es excelente persona,trabajadora  madre de 4 hermosas criaturas se dedica a la compra,ventas de artículos  alimenticios bebidas en general, y quiere incursionar en la venta de calzados.
Ella quiere tener en su negocio calzados de vaR. tipos y modelos, y para comprarlos solicita el préstamo a la Fundación Paraguaya.
Ella esta con el negocio buen tiempo y cuenta con clientela formada, y esta muy satisfecha con su trabajo ya que  mediante los ingresos que obtuvo con su negocio pudo educar a sus hijos de la mejor manera posible.
texts.en:
Luciana Zunilda R. is an excellent person. She is a hardworking mother of 4 beautiful children who buys and sells a variety of groceries and would like to begin to sell shoes. Luciana would like to start a business selling a variety of types and styles of shoes, and to buy them she is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya. She has had her business for a long time and has many loyal customers. She is very happy with her work since the income it yields enables her to provide the best education possible for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes

loans.name: San Patricio Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Patricio está conformado por tres féminas emprendedoras, luchadoras y esforzadas originarias de Masaya ciudad de las flores donde su economía se basa en la agricultura. Ellas se dedican al comercio de perecederos en el mercado de Masaya.
La coordinadora del grupo es Paulina Bermúdez de 47 años quien desde 1990 se dedica al comercio de verduras y tiene una pequeña venta en su casa. Las otras integrantes son Francisca U. quien compra y vende frutas negocio en el que lleva 36 años y Juana Paula Rodríguez comercializa papaya y naranjas.
texts.en:
The San Patricio (Saint Patrick) group is composed of three enterprising, hard working and dedicated women from Masaya, city of flowers, whose economy is based on agriculture. They are foodstuffs merchants in Masaya’s market. The group coordinator is Paulina Bermúdez, 47, who has sold vegetables since 1990 and has a small store in her home. The other members are: Francisca U. who has sold fruits and vegetables for 36 years and Juana Paula Rodríguez who sells oranges and papayas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita V. is from the village of Cabisera 5, Baribad. She is 60 years old. Benita is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Benita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Benita has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP per harvest for these activities.

In 2010, Benita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Benita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar M. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family have been living together in the same apartment where the children were raised for the past thirteen  years. His wife used to work as a tailor and then she started to run her own sewing business. His two daughters both attend a local secondary school in Ulaanbaatar. 

Since 1995, they have started several businesses, such as sewing, a bath house and a sauna. They used to operate their businesses in a rented basement of an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, but due to high rental prices they started running their businesses at their home. 

Erdenebaatar recently expanded his businesses by hiring a new hairdresser. In the future he hopes to grow his business by adding a new laundry service. Besides his businesses, he works at Atmor company as a water equipment installer. Erdenebaatar works very hard and is a clever man.  

He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to make a renovation at his bath house.

loans.use: To make a renovation at his bath house.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

La socia Tomasa; la socia tiene 64 años de edad y es casada, la socia tiene  un pequeño taller artesanal, ella realiza textiles y ahora desea comprar una arpillera para realizar los textiles y poderlos exhibir, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una arpillera para sus trabajos de textilería.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Communal bank "NUEVA VICTORIA (NEW VICTORY) - CHINCHERO." This bank is located in the Chinchero district, Urubamba province, and Cusco district. It is located 45 minutes from the city.

Member Tomasa is 64 years old, married, and owns a small art shop. She produces fabrics and now she wants to buy sackcloth to make clothes and be able to exhibit them. The loan will then be used to buy sackcloth for her textile work.

The member is thankful for the loan being available through this medium and in the same manner commits to repay the loan in the scheduled payments.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sackcloth for her textile work.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou  est une e femme mariée ayant 4 enfants et dont l’âge varie entre 0et 4 ans. Elle habite dans la localité de Dalifort .Elle est âgée  de 43 ans. Elle enseigne dans une institution préscolaire de la localité. Mais depuis 9 ans elle s’active dans le commerce de produits cométiques. Son  objectif est d’augmenter ses revenus pour pouvoir soutenir sa famille. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Dalifort depuis 9 mois. Elle emprunte 200 000 destine a l’achat de produits cosmétiques qu’elle va vendre par placement auprès  de ses amies et connaissances du quartier. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de renforcer son soutien a  l’endroit de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Seynabou is a married woman with 4 children whose ages vary from less than 1 year to 4 years. She lives in the Dalifort area and is 43 years old. She teaches at a preschool institution in the area. However, for 9 years, she has been active in selling cosmetics. Her goal is to increase her income to be able to support her family. She has been a member of the Dalifort local fund for 9 months. She is borrowing 200,000 F, to be used to buy cosmetics that she will sell at home to her friends and acquaintances in the area. This loan will allow her to increase her profits and strengthen her ability to support her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her working capital

loans.name: Angela Ana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Angela, tiene 40 años de edad está casada y tiene 6 hijos, 4 de ellos ya son mayores de edad, tres de sus hijos viven con ella. El esposo es comerciante.

Tiene un local comercial donde vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, bisutería y otros artículos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 12h00 y de 14h00 hasta las 18h00, trabaja con la ayuda de tres chicas a las que les paga un sueldo. Sus productos los compra en Quito y Guayaquil una vez al mes.

Es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco y le ha gustado por la facilidad de los pagos y los intereses bajos. Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar mercadería.
 
Su meta es poner otro local en Portoviejo.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the members of Salud y Vida Community Bank meet every 15 days. This area is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente. 

Angela is 40 years old, married and has 6 children. Four of them are already adults and three of her children live with her. Her husband is an entrepreneur. 

She has a local shop where she sells all kinds of clothes, shoes, costume jewelry and other items. She works every day from 8am until 12pm and from 2pm until 6pm. She has three employees who help her and she pays them each a salary. She buys her products in Quito and Guayaquil once each month. 

This is her 4th cycle with the Bank and she likes it because of the ease of making payments and the low interest rates. She will use this credit to buy more merchandise. Her goal is to open another shop in Portoviejo.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes and costume jewelry

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda R. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 57 years old. Luzviminda is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Luzviminda also manages a small piggery for raising pigs for fattening.

Luzviminda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and feed.

loans.name: Augusta Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Angel Lucy, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos (9 – 1 mes)
Daniela, solicita el crédito para aumentar su mercadería, ahora ya se acerca la campaña navideña comprará juguetes, panteones, leche, abarrotes en general.
Daniela comenzó a trabajar desde muy joven ayudando a su tía, viaja a Bolivia, Sicuani, Puno, comercializaban casacas de cuero, pero desde que tuvo a su hijita ya no puede realizar  viajes muy largos. 
Ahora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como: Arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, detergentes, etc. Estos productos los lleva a las ferias de la Selva se vende bien.
Le gusta las reuniones de su banco comunal porque puede ahorrar y su dinero gana intereses, sobre todo hay confianza es una institución seria.
En una oportunidad cuando fue a una de las ferias de la Selva Ayacuchana sufrió un asalto en el lugar denominado Tacuna.
Su sueño es construir su casa propia, cuenta con un terreno que le heredo su padre y tener un negocio propio en la selva.
texts.en:
Daniela, 30, is married and has two children (a nine-year-old and a one-month old); she is a member of the Tu Ángel Lucy communal bank.

Daniela is asking for funds to increase inventory now that the Christmas season is approaching.  She will buy toys, pants, milk and groceries.

Daniela started working with her aunt while still very young.  She would travel to Bolivia, Sicuani and Puno to sell leather jackets.  However, once her daughter was born she was no longer able to make long trips.

Now she sells general groceries like: rice, sugar, noodles, milk, detergents, etc.  She takes them to the markets in the jungle where they sell well.

She enjoys the communal bank meetings because she can save and her money earns interest.  Above all, there is trust because it’s a serious institution.

On one of the trips to a market in the Ayacucho jungle she was robbed in a place called Tacuna.

Her dream is to build her own house; she has a lot that she inherited from her father, and to have her own business in the jungle.

loans.use: To buy toys.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity U., 30 years old and married to a builder, has four children, all of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, Charity hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant to cook and sell

loans.name: Huanish

texts.en:
Huanish A. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All of his three children attend the local secondary school while his wife works as a salesperson in the local grocery shop. 

Huanish operates an animal raw-material trading business in his local market. He purchases raw materials from the countryside and sells them at his local market as a retailer. He began the business in 2003 and has built a stable operation. In addition, he also works as a driver in a company to supplement his earnings. 

Today, his working capital exceeds 500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). He plans to buy his own car in the future. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to increase his working capital for his raw-material trading business.

loans.use: To purchase animal rawhides

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak P. is a hard-working woman who earns her living by working on the rubber plantation as well feeding some pigs behind her house for extra profit. His husband also works in rubber plantation too. This family normally earns an average of $3 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. They have three kids who all work in different occupations. Recently, her pigs are not big enough due to the lack of food. To help solve this problem, Prak P. has requested a loan that she will use to buy additional feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.use: To buy additional feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Matha Aurora

texts.es:
Martha de 55 años, tiene mucho tiempo fabricando zapatos con ayuda de su familia y vendiéndolos en un puesto de la bahía (zona muy comercial donde se ubican comerciantes en locales a vender mercadería). 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral muy cerca del trinipuerto donde descargan los barcos de mercadería comenzó a fabricar los zapatos con su familia hace varios años atrás para venderlos a la había. En la actualidad hace tres docenas de zapatos para vender. Tiene su taller de fabricación de zapatos en su casa ya que se le hace más fácil. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere continuar comprando con el préstamo cuero, pegamento, materiales para poder producir más. En el futuro quiere comprar una máquina para una buena fabricación de zapatos.
texts.en:
Martha is 55 years old.  For a long time she has been making shoes, with the help of her family, and selling them from a stall in La Bahía (an area with a lot of commercial activity where salespeople set up in premises to sell merchandise).

Martha lives in a peri-urban area called Perimetral which is very near the Trinipuerto where cargo ships unload their merchandise.  She started making shoes with her family several years ago so that she could sell them in La Bahía.  She is currently making three dozen pairs of shoes to sell.  She has her shoe workshop in her home since it is easier that way.

Martha has a lot of aspirations for her business.  For this reason, she would like to continue in her business, using her loan to buy leather, adhesive and materials so that she can produce more shoes.  In the future, she would like to buy a machine so that she can make her shoes even better.

loans.use: To buy leather, adhesive and materials

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana lives in a small city of Pakistan called Khanewal. Khanewal is located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. Her house contains 2 rooms where she has been living for over 10 years with her family. 

She is 42 years old, married to I. H. and has 2 sons. Her elder son left school after the 8th grade and started a business, making and selling furniture. Now he is an expert in his work and doing this business on a full-time basis. Her youngest son is studying in the 8th grade.

Rukhsana’s husband manufactures sewing machines and she supports him financially by operating a boutique  business. She prepares different kinds of dresses such as simple, embroidered and dresses with stylish designs to display in her boutique and sell to her customers. She uses an area of her house to display her collection to her customers and earn income for the family.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her boutique business. With the loan, she will buy clothes, thread and beads in bulk which will help her to offer more finished products to her customers and increase her income.  She has been operating her business for over 10 years and she is very hopeful that this investment will take her business to more profitable level. 
She is new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy clothes, thread and beads for preparing dresses to display and sell in a boutique

loans.name: Santos Segundo

texts.es:
Santos tiene 66 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a sus esposa y sus hijos en el caserío de Pueblo Libre, una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, Santos siembra limón y mango en un pequeño terreno de cultivo que esta a pocos metros de su vivienda, además posee algunas aves que ofrece a la venta a sus vecinos o comerciantes que visitan la zona donde reside. Esta actividad es una fuente importante de ingreso a la economía de su familia

Santos desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Santos es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar lacalidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 66, is married living with his wife and children in Pueblo Libre, a rural area located in Tambogrande district, Piura region, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

He works in jobs associated with agriculture.  He grows lemons and mangoes on a small plot a few meters from his house.   He also has fowl that he sells to his neighbors or merchants who frequent the area where he lives.  This activity is an important source of income for the family’s economy.

Santos wants to acquire fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his crops.  He hopes this action will lead to a good harvest.  He has, therefore, found himself in the need of asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan.

Santos is quite a calm and responsible person.  His greatest wish is to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To acquire fertilizer and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: David Waithaka

texts.en:
David, age 24, has been distributing water in Naivaha town using his donkey and cart for the last three years. He and his wife, Esther Wangui, have one child.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid off his first loan of Kshs 10,000 regularly and promptly. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorcycle for transportation as he seeks to upgrade his business and to venture into new endeavors.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to upgrade his business and to venture into new endeavors

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a thirty-year-old married female with four children, living in her own house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in cassava flour for the last seven years starting with a capital of 500,000 shillings. She now has 1,000,000 shillings. Her goal is to own a food store and her challenge is prolonged drought that leads to low yields of cassava. Mary needs the loan to buy cassava flour.

loans.use: Buying cassava flour

loans.name: María Luz

texts.es:
La Señora. María T. es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, vive en la comunidad de las Minas que pertenece a la parroquia de Nulti, esta parroquia tiene hermosos paisaje, su gente se dedica a la artesanía, cría de animales y agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes actividades.

Doña María tiene 20 años, tiene una relación de unión libre y aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo labora operando maquinaria pesada, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus padres compartiendo gastos.

Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y va a iniciarse en el negocio de cría de pollos.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermana, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, alimento y otros artículos para iniciar su negocio. Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria T. is a member of the communal bank named Vegaspamba. She lives in the community of Las Minas, belonging to the district of Nulti. This district has many beautiful sceneries and its population is made up of artisans, farmers, and agriculturists. Many work in the city of Cuenca in different occupations.

Maria is 20 years old and she is married common-law and she still doesn't have any children. Her husband works as a heavy machinery operator. They don't have a house of their own so they live in her parents' house and they share the expenses. 

She is a housewife but she will start a poultry business.

She is on her third loan through the communal bank, to which she was invited to join by her sister. She will invest the funds from her loan to purchase poultry, feed, and all that she needs to start the business. Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase poultry, feed, and all that she needs to start a business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support four children. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Marilou requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Marilou is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to pay for an envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia M., 36, a resident of Gamban Riverside, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Ireneo M., a shoe repairman. They have been blessed with children who are still studying right now. At this time, Delia is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Delia, as she herself is a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children. 

Delia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos' worth of cooking oil or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail piece rates. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operation of her variety store, she is requesting a 45,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages so as to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Delia dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work in her business. She looks forward to having her children get a stable job someday. Delia also prays for her own commercial space in their public market. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting* where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for restocking and expanding her variety store

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, reside en  San Rafael Oriente, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad, Julio aprendió de su padre el proceso de la siembra de maíz y frijol, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 4:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, estos son necesarios para la siembra de maíz, con estos materiales espera tener los insumos que necesita el proceso  y llevar a cabo el trabajo del cual depende su familia.
Su objetivo es tener el negocio por mucho tiempo, recibir buenas cosechas para poder comercializar y ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Julio lives in San Rafael Oriente, in the region of Morazán. He plants corn and beans. He lives with his wife and two children who are 7 and 5 years old. Julio learned how to plant corn and beans from his father. He works every day from 6:00am to 4:00pm.
He is asking for the loan to buy manure and fertilizer. These are necessary for the planting of corn. With these materials he hopes to have the materials that the process needs, and to carry out the work that his family relies upon.
His goal is to have the business for a long time, have good harvests to be able to sell in the market, and help his children in their studies.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Joriline

texts.en:
Joriline is from the village of Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Joriline is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $45 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Joriline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook products for sale. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook products for sale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 35 years of age and married with one child. She owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business. 

Fatima needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or $146 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Fatima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Fatima's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old and married, with 2 children.  Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like bread, groceries, etc,. in her sari-sari store.

Vilma has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending and ready-to-wear clothes.  Vilma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: 1 - Tân Xuân - Hoằng Phụ - Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Ngoan is applying for a loan to improve her business. She has a grocery store.

Ngoan is 34 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 1 - Hoằng Phụ - Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

This is Ngoan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ngoan has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Ngoan hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: To purchase materials to maintain her grocery store.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 46 years old and married. She has seven children, three of which are in school.

Salama is in the agricultural business as a rice farmer in the Philippines. Salama requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Salama has been farming rice for 10 years now, and she has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Salama would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gbediga Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEDIGA est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Ayaba Aubierge, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Ayaba Aubierge est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Marius. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont les leurs. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Ayaba Aubierge n’a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Il y a près de quatre ans que Ayaba Aubierge exerce comme activité, la vente de mèches tissage, des savons et des produits de toilettes, par le système de distribution ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Ayaba Aubierge s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Ayaba Aubierge désire renforcer son capital et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Ayaba Aubierge sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDIGA, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
GBEDIGA is a group formed of three persons who live in the same district in Benin. The group’s representative, named Ayaba Aubierge, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time that this group has requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of boosting their business. Ayaba Aubierge is 28 years old and married to a teacher by the name of Marius. They support three children, of whom two are their own. All of the children are in school. This couple lives together with their children and jointly covers the various need of the family. 

Ayaba Aubierge attended primary school only.  For nearly four years, she has had a business selling hair extensions, weaves, soaps, and personal care products, via the distribution system. This enables her to respond to family needs without much trouble. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Concerned about responding to the requirements of her customers, she would like to bolster her capital and raise her level of business. To do so, she and the other member of the group GBEDIGA are requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of soap, 6 dozen weaves, and some personal care products

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 42 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Norte. Evelyn has a sari-sari store business and earns approximately 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for additional capital. Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for this year 2011. In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store

loans.name: Kinuthia

texts.en:
For the last seven years, Kinuthia has been buying and selling charcoal as his primary business and operating an electronics shop as his secondary business. He is 26 years old and married to Leah. They have been blessed with one child.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff. This is his first loan. He has been loaned KES.50,000. He intends to use the loan to buy repair tools for his electronics shop.

In future, Kinuthia hopes that both his businesses will be successful and his income will increase.

loans.use: To buy tools for electronic repairs.

loans.name: Carmen Jessenia

texts.es:
Carmen de 28 años de edad, es soltera, vive en su casa propia,  no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Catacaos que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería, artesanía y turismo.

Carmen se dedica a la elaboración, venta de chicha de jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base de maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú), actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado de generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas de la chicha de jora en la zona donde vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida.  

Teniendo la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio Carmen a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mesas, sillas, insumos para la chicha de jora y realizar algunos arreglos en su negocio, con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y mejorar economicamente.
texts.en:
28-year-old Carmen is single and lives in her own home which doesn't have basic services.  Her house is located in the rural part of Catacaos district, in Piura department.  Throughout this area, local people work in farming, livestock raising, handicrafts and tourism.

Carmen makes and sells 'chicha de jora' (a delicious drink made from corn which is drunk a lot in the north of Peru).  She has been in this business for several years.  It is a custom which has been handed down from generation to generation.  Recently, sales of 'chicha de jora' have increased in Carmen's area which has been good news for her.  She has been able to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

As she has the opportunity to improve her business, Carmen has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy tables, chairs and supplies for making 'chicha de jora'.  She will also make some repairs.  Her goal is to make more profits and increase her number of customers.  This will enable her to repay her loan and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and supplies for making 'chicha de jora', and to make some repairs

loans.name: Athuman

texts.en:
Athuman is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, he has operated a butcher shop business, operating from the market, whereby his potential customers are neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of competition from other butcher shop operators. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan he wants to purchase a bull for slaughtering and a cutting machine. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a bull for slaughtering and a cutting machine.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia works hard to support her family. Nemia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Nemia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and other equipments.

Nemia has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Nemia would like to save enough money to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other equipment

loans.name: Lope

texts.en:
Lope is hard working father of four. He is 56 years old and is married. Lope is involved in the agricultural businesses of rice farming and hog raising. Lope’s wife is a housekeeper and his partner in managing the business to gain higher income and further bestow the needs of his family.

Lope is having difficulties providing feed for his hogs. As such, he has decided to request a loan amounting to P30,000 to purchase feed and vaccines for his hogs. He hopes to maintain and continue the operations of his business as an additional source of income of the family. Lope believes that the loan will have a positive impact on his business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: Juan Manuel de 36 años esta casado con Laura de 39 años, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de el,  tiene tres años y medio viviendo en una casa de interés social que adquirió en el 2008 misma que aun le siguen descontando en su empleo vía nomina. Para el su familia es lo mas importante y de ello el que tengan un lugar cómodo para vivir hace 1 año el con ahorros propios coloco una maya ciclónica al frente de su domicilio para darles un lugar seguro a sus hijos donde pudieran jugar y hoy en día nos solicita el apoyo para quitar la maya ciclónica que coloco y levantar una barda de block esto con la ilusión de que algún día pueda ampliar su casa para que cada uno de sus hijos tenga su propio espacio. Para construir la barda necesita comprar block, arena, varillas y pagar al albañil.
texts.en: Juan Manuel, 36, is married to Lourdes, 39, and has two children that depend economically on him.  He’s been living in a public subsidized house for three and a half years; he got it in 2008 and is still having the payments discounted from his paycheck.  For his family, it’s what’s most important so that they can have a comfortable place to live.  A year ago he used his own savings to install a cyclone fence in front of his house to provide a secure place for his children to play in.  Today, he’s asking us for a loan to remove the cyclone fence that he installed and erect a concrete block wall hoping with this to someday enlarge the house so that each of his children can have his own space.  To build the wall he needs to buy concrete blocks, sand, rebar and to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to erect a wall.

loans.name: Rosita Marcela

texts.es:
Rosita Marcela tiene 34 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres y hermanos en el Cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Rosita se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad del producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: los intermediarios y las plagas. El sueño es comprar más terreno para tener más producciones.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  disfrutar de las festividades de la localidad.
texts.en:
Rosita Marcela is 34 years old.  She is single with no children, and lives with her parents and siblings in the Chillanes canton in Bolívar province.

The San José community bank is made up of 21 members.  It is located in the parish of San José del Tambo, 60 minutos away from the main office.  This bank's members work in short-term agriculture, such as growing corn, plantains, and cocoa.

Rosita works in agriculture growing corn, plantains and cocoa.  She makes her purchases and sales in the parish of San José del Tambo. She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte brand herbicide, fertilizers, and weedkiller to keep her crops in good condition.

The loan will be of great help, because she will be able to improve her products' quality.  The challenges that she faces most frequently are dealing with intermediaries and pest infestations.

In her free time she likes to enjoy the local festivals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte brand herbicide, fertilizers and weedkiller.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha wants to prove that even a woman can do farming activities. Alpha is 39 years old, married with four children who are in college and high school levels of education. 

Alpha’s husband is a farmer, her partner in managing their farm. Alpha and her husband plant rice in their village. Most of her earnings in farming have gone for the education of her children. 

Alpha wants to gain higher income from her farm to further support her children's education and uplift their living standard. Alpha is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor in farming activities. She hopes to maintain her business in farming and able to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.ru: Тохирджон отец троих детей, любящий семьянин. Жена работает поваром. Они уделяют особое внимание воспитанию и образованию детей. Тохирджон предоставляет услуги такси в своем городе. Также у него дома крупный рогатый скот. После откорма продает и получает прибыль. Он хочет получить займ на покупку несколько голов скота. Он знает, что на свете есть добрые люди, которые всегда готовы протянуть руку помощи нуждающимся. Он надеется получить займ в размере 4000 сомони для покупки КРС. Он заранее благодарен всем.
texts.en: Tohirjon is a father of three children and a loving family man.  His wife works as a cook.  They pay special attention to raising and educating their children.  Tohirjon provides a taxi service in his city.  He also has cattle at home.  He sells livestock after fattening it up and earns a profit.  Tohirjon wants to obtain this loan to purchase several heads of livestock.  He knows that there a kind people in the world, who are always ready to extend a helping hand to the needy.  He hopes to get a loan in the sum of 4000 somoni to buy cattle.  Tohirjon thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Familia Hernandez Group

texts.es:
Familia Hernández el grupo se llama así ya que el nombre se lo eligió doña Guadalupe porque en el solo participan familiares Hernandez su esposo Hilario y su Nuera Irma, es la primera vez que están en el crédito.
Sin embargo ellos se dedican  al comercio doña Guadalupe quien es representante del grupo tiene 60 años de edad vive en unión libre con el señor Hilario desde hace 33 años don Hilario trabaja en el campo, 
Los tres invertirán en sus negocios la tienda de abarrotes, y la papelería, son negocios familiares, la tienda la atiende Irma el negocio lo inicio sus esposo pero ella es quien ha quedado a cargo, lleva poco escasamente tres meses, y la tienda lleva ya 30 años esa la atiende doña Guadalupe, y don Hilario.
Esta vez doña Guadalupe ha adquirido el crédito para comprar todo lo que le hace falta en el negocio como detergente, leche, pan , huevo, productos enlatados, harinas, refrescos, arroz, semillas, mientras que Irma invertirá en la papelería, comprado mochilas, y cuadernos que es lo que mas le urge por el momento.
El desafío que presenta doña Guadalupe es que tiene mucha competencia abren muchas tiendas cercanas a la de ella por eso sus  ventas han bajado considerablemente ya que anteriormente obtenía el doble o triple de ganancias que las que ahora saca.
Sin embargo una de sus metas es volver atener la tienda bien surtida, ya que muchas veces las tiendas cierran muy rápido pero ella siempre le ha gustado tener su tienda, también quisiera ampliarla un poco mas.
Ellos están muy agradecidos con el préstamo que les hace doña Guadalupe comenta “Estoy muy contenta por la oportunidad que me han brindado, ya que sin su ayuda yo no podría haber levantado nunca el negocio, porque no tenia dinero para comprar lo que a mi tienda le hace falta, para nosotros es mucho mas difícil conseguir dinero ya que mi esposos gana muy poco y las ganancias de la tienda son para irla pasado”
texts.en:
Familia Hernández: the group has this name because it was chosen by Guadalupe because only members of the Hernandez family participate, such as her husband Hilario and her daughter in law Irma. This is the first time they are on the loan.  

They work as merchants. Guadalupe is the group's representative. She is 60 year old and has been in a common law marriage with Hilario for 33 years. Hilario works in the fields.  
 
The three will invest in their businesses, a grocery store and paper store. These are family businesses. Irma attends to the store. Her husband started the business but she is the one who is in charge of it. She has been doing this for three months, but the business is already 30 years old. Guadalupe and Hilario run it.

This time, Guadalupe has taken out the loan to buy everything she needs for the business, such as detergent, milk, bread, eggs, canned goods, drinks, rice, and seeds. Irma will invest in her paper store such as backpacks and notebooks, which is what is most needed at this time.  

Guadalupe's challenge is that there is a lot of competition. A lot of stores have been opened nearby and because of that her sales have gone down considerably, since before she made double or triple what she makes now. Nonetheless, one of her goals is to have a well stocked store again, since a lot of store close quickly, but she has always liked having her store. She would also like to enlarge it a little.  

They are very grateful for the loan. Guadalupe remarks: “I am very happy with the opportunity that has been given me, since without your help I would never have been able to lift the business up, because I didn't have the money to buy what my store needed. For us it has been very difficult to get money, since my husband makes very little, and the earnings from the store are to make more.”

loans.use: to buy bread, milk, eggs, drinks, and canned goods.

loans.name: Donik

texts.ru:
Доник родился 1956 г. в городе Капане, окончил среднюю школу в деревне Севакар, а после окончание школы поступил и окончил Капанский горный техникум, где получил специальность электромеханика. В данный момент Доник работает электриком.
Доник женат и у него четверо детей: три сына и дочь. Дочь и старший сын имеют свои семьи и живут отдельно от родителей. Средний и младший сыновья живут вместе с родителями.
Параллельно с работой электриком, Доник занимается сельским хозяйством уже почти 20 лет. В деревне Севакар у него есть небольшой участок земли, на котором он выращивает овощи и фрукты, разводит крупный рогатый скот и кур. Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию Доник реализует в городе Капане. Жена и два сына помогают Донику в сельскохозяйственной деятельности, благодаря чему они содержат семью и ежедневно обеспечивают ее необходимыми свежими продуктами.
Кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм необходим Донику для приобретения двух коров и трех телят, что поможет ему в будущем увеличить доход своей семьи. Данный кредит является третьим по счету, получаемым Доником от организации Нор Оризон.
texts.en: Donik was born 1956 in the city of Kapan.  He finished a secondary school in the Sevakar village, and then, after finishing school, was accepted and graduated from the Kapan Mining College, where he obtained a profession of an electrician.  Currently, Donik works an electrician.  Donik is married and has four children: three sons and a daughter.  His daughter and oldest son already have their own families and live separately from the parents.  The middle and youngest sons live with the parents.  Parallel to his electrician work, Donik has been involved in agriculture for almost 20 years.  He has a small plot of land in the Sevakar village, where he grows vegetables and fruits and breeds cattle and chickens.  Donik sells his agricultural products in the city of Kapan.  His wife and two sons help Donik with the agricultural business, thanks to which they support the family and provide it daily with the necessary, fresh products.  Donik needs a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 dram to purchase two cows and three calves, which would help him to increase his family's income in the future.  This is Donik's third loan from the Nor Horizon organization.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and three calves

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is a construction worker. His wife, Sokhon, is a rice farmer and also sells sugar cane juice when she is free from farming. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh and have one married daughter.

Thy is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to repair the house where he lives because the house needs repairs in some areas.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Jusilene

texts.en:
Jusilene is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jusilene has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jusilene has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jusilene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Ms Son is 33 years old with two school-aged children. She manages a small grocery store. Her shop opened seven years ago and provides a stable income for her family. Participating in our credit program in 2008, she found it suitable for her business. Currently, she wants a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnamese dong to buy more products to sell for the Tet holiday.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell for the Tet holiday.

loans.name: Niño Divino Group

texts.es: Socias formado por cuatros socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Rita que se dedica a vender verduras,como tomate, chiltoma, cebolla, yuca,  perecederos ambulantes desde hace 8 años, inicio vendiendo fritanga en su domicilio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de verduras y perecederos, Juana vende repuestos para motos, Julia vende cereales y Araceli también vende cereales.
texts.en:
This group has four entrepreneurial members, one of whom is Rita.  Rita's business is selling vegetables such as tomatoes, sweet peppers, onions, cassava and other perishable food products.  She has been selling these products as an itinerant street vendor for eight years, having initially started out in business selling fried food from her home.  She will invest this loan in buying vegetables and perishable food products.

Juana sells motorcycle spare parts, Julia sells cereals and Araceli also sells cereals.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, sweet peppers, cassava, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es:
Abigail, de 63 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos y todos tienen sus propios hogares y solamente vive con nieto y su esposo.

Abigail, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la venta de frutas y verduras en un lugar cerca de un desvió, ella tiene este pequeño negocio desde hace 5 años y lo aprendió sola, porque en el lugar es una estación de buses y la distancia está a 45 minutos caminando y su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 de la tarde. 

Abigail, necesita el préstamo para comprar jocotes, piña, naranjas, sandias y otras frutas que se venden más.

Los sueños de Abigail, sueña con tener un cafetín y así poder tener más productos a la venta.

loans.use: para comprar jocotes, piña, naranjas, sandias y otras frutas que se venden más.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
"I am proud to be a LAPO client," says Mrs. Tina O.. She is 26 years old, and is married with four children. She sells local drinks for the community. She is from Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She says if she is loaned the above 
amount, her business will improve tremendously.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Selega

texts.en: Selega is 43 years old, married and has one child.  As the main income earner for her immediate and extended family, she applied for a loan from SPBD several years ago.  She used the initial and subsequent loans to purchase fishing nets and set up her taro plantation.  Now with both agricultural projects running, she can earn up to ST 300 (approximately USD 115) a week, which is enough to provide the basic necessities for her family.  But Selega is committed to raising her family’s standard of living further and she seeks an additional loan to buy fungicides to increase her taro yield and to make some necessary repairs to her fishing equipment.

loans.use: Purchase fungicides and repair her fishing equipment

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir makes a living using his taxi to transport people around Ivano-Frankovsk and surrounding areas in the western Ukraine. Personal vehicles are too expensive for most people to afford in the Ukraine. Transportation services such as buses and taxis like Vladimir’s provide a valuable means of getting around for many, many people. Vladimir owns his own car, but works with a dispatching company called Radio 051 to coordinate calls. He has a radio in his car that enables him to quickly respond to requests for a taxi. Vladimir currently makes around $35 per day, enough for him to support himself and his wife, Olga. 

Vladimir has requested a loan of $500 to help him with some maintenance on his taxi. He has been in business for three years and has put a lot of kilometers on his car. Eventually he’d like to purchase a much newer car, but until that time, this loan will help him keep his vehicle in good working order.

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: Mrs. Hin N. is 31 years old and lives in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia with her husband (shown in the photo) and three children. She works for a company that weighs both cars and trucks. She would now like to open a grocery store. However, she needs additional funding to help with the start-up costs. Thus, Mrs. Hin N. is applying for a loan in order to launch her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy grocery products to run a business

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es:
Claudia is a brave woman who goes out each and finds ways to sell nutritious goods like raw honey, cheese, and sometimes, trouts to delight the Huancaya citizens' palates. However, for these aforementioned sales, she also receives a lot of commission. For three years, she has been able to more than meet her target and has had plentiful income for her living expenses. She has taken her young son along to the city to sell these products. She travels every fifteen days to the capital city with the intention of making successful sales as well as doing some embroidery, which she started a little while ago. This activity also generates some additional income to meet the lifestyle she is used to. Since she has her young son to support, she wishes to set up a store to take care of him like a good mother ought to. If she does this, she envisions a brighter future for her family. Thus, she seeks a loan of $275 to invest in more merchandise so she can sell and make greater profits. In this way, she will be able to save and realize her dream sooner. Your generosity will be like soothing honey to this sweet mother's anxieties.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Claudia es una mujer valerosa que cada día trabaja de manera independiente en la venta de productos alimenticios como la miel de abeja, quesos y a veces truchas para el deleite de los paladares huancaínos. Sin embargo por la comercialización del primer producto que les mencionamos recibe muchos más réditos y hace trece años ha podido satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar plenamente, en compañía de su ultimo retoño recorre la ciudad para vender sus productos. Así mismo viaja cada quince días a la ciudad capital de su país con el propósito de realizar sus ventas también en este lugar, de manera adicional ha iniciado hace poco el bordado de fustanes y esta actividad le está generando un ingreso adicional para incrementar el nivel de vida familiar. Como buena madre que es anhela establecerse en un local por el cuidado que tiene que brindarle a su pequeño hijo. Así mismo ve con mucho optimismo su futuro a lado de su amada familia, es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares con el fin de invertirlos en la compra de más artículos con el propósito de obtener mayores ganancias y de esa manera ahorrar y hacer realidad su anhelo en corto tiempo.Usted podrá hacer que la miel de su generosidad satisfaga las ansias de esta dulce madre.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to eventually be able to set up her own store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Baldovina's Group

texts.es:
In the city of Quiindy, 20 km. away from the city of Carapeguá, a group of women of scarce resources heard of the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women) committee program developed by Fundación Paraguaya and decided to form a group looking for support in developing their family income through microcredit.

These individuals grew thanks to this program and are currently in its fifth cycle, having now more than 14 months in the program and succeeding by being excellent clients since the beginning. Four clients are missing in the attached photograph because they could not attend the gathering where it was taken due to travel involving the sale of their products.

The majority of the members are artisans who create hanging hammocks, blankets and ao poi embroidery, one of the most traditional and recognized techniques in Paraguay. Others are fashion designers, peddlers and makers of pigskin footballs.

They are requesting this loan to buy the different kinds of materials that they each need to perform their activities, among them we can list: waxed, wool and cotton threads; needles; fabrics; buttons; zippers; leather; etc.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de Quiindy, distante a 20 km. de la ciudad de Carapeguá, un grupo de señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras que desarrolla la Fundación Paraguaya y decidieron formar su grupo buscando un apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito, sus ingresos familiares

Estas personas crecieron gracias a este programa y actualmente se encuentran dentro del quinto ciclo del mismo, teniendo ya 14 de meses dentro del programa y destacándose por ser clientes excelentes desde sus inicios. Faltan 4 clientes en la fotografía adjunta debido a que ellas por motivos de viajes laborales de venta de sus productos no pudieron asistir a la reunión en la que se tomó la fotografía.

La mayoría de las integrantes son artesanas que se dedican a la confección de hamacas colgantes, colchas, y bordados de ao poí que es una de las técnicas más reconocidas y típicas del Paraguay. Otras son modistas, vendedoras ambulantes y confeccionistas de pelotas de football.

Solicitan el crédito para comprar los distintos tipos de materiales que cada una necesita para desarrollar su actividad, entre ellos podemos citar: hilos encerados, hilos de lana y algodón, agujas, telas, botones, cierres, cuero, etc.

loans.use: Purchase waxed, wool and cotton threads; needles; fabrics; buttons; zippers; leather; etc.

loans.name: Humay

texts.en: Ms. Humay is a low-income, vulnerable woman. She is 36, married, and has two children and lives in the village of Saatli city in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Humay owns a small herd of milk cows.
